title: Gränssnittsutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Minst sex års erfarenhet av UX/UI-arbete samt frontendutveckling med HTML, CSS och React
* Minst nio års erfarenhet av vanilla JavaScript
* Erfarenhet av arbete i eller mot HCL Digital Experience
* Erfarenhet av tillgänglighetsarbete enligt WCAG
* Praktisk erfarenhet av Figma eller motsvarande designverktyg
* Erfarenhet av JSP
* Erfarenhet av Git
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-flöden, exempelvis Jenkins

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 05-02-2026 **Om Oss**  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.


Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?  

  

*Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Junior Embedded engineeer – C/C++/rust
description:
About Cyberway
  
At Cyberway, we believe that technology can make everyday life simpler, smarter, and more sustainable — for businesses, organizations, and people. That’s why we create solutions that truly make a difference. We combine deep technical expertise with strategic insight, always aiming to transform complex digital challenges into clear, scalable, and future-proof results.
  
We believe in more than just code — we believe in people. It’s the passion, skills, and collaboration of individuals that drive real change. Whether it’s system development, data analysis, UI/UX, infrastructure, or delivery models such as nearshore and team as a service, we build success through experience, innovation, and action — with the right people at the core.
  
  

The Role
  
We are now looking for an engineer who wants to join our journey. With us, you’ll have the opportunity to work with modern technologies, exciting clients, and projects that make a real impact. The role is diverse — sometimes you’ll work independently, sometimes in teams, always in close dialogue with both customers and colleagues.
  
We believe you have a background that makes you confident in your skills, while also being curious to develop new ones. Most importantly, you want to contribute to building the Cyberway culture together with us.
  
  

What We're Looking For
  
1+ year of experience in embedded software development and/or testing
  
Basic proficiency in C and/or C++ (Rust is a plus)
  
Familiarity with Linux/Unix tools and workflows
  
Understanding of software design fundamentals and requirement handling
  
Interest in automotive communication (Automotive Ethernet UDP/TCP, CAN, LIN)
  
Exposure to debugging and test case design in embedded systems
  
Python and/or Bash scripting for automation is a plus
  
Familiarity with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins is a plus
  
Interest in diagnostics protocols such as UDS and DoIP is a plus
  
Strong communication skills in English and a collaborative, curious mindset
  
  

What We Offer
  
Exciting and challenging assignments where you make a real difference
  
A work environment built on transparency, trust, and openness
  
Flexibility to work as a subcontractor or as an employee — we support you in building the career path that suits you best
  
The opportunity to influence both your own development and Cyberway’s future
  
A culture where innovation, people, and action go hand in hand
  
  

Location
  
For this role, we are looking for someone based in Skåne, as many of our clients and projects are located in the region.

title: Senior Business Analysts with Technical flair for Nordic LINK Go Deployments
description:
*Are you passionate about bridging business analysis with hands-on technical configuration? Do you thrive in a dynamic, Nordic environment where your expertise in deployment and configuration makes a tangible impact? Then you might be the new Senior Business Analyst to join our growing Nordic team and help us deliver and optimize KPMG LINK Go deployments for our global client base.*


**Welcome to the Nordic Tax & Legal Technology team**  

Join a Nordic team of 40+ dedicated professionals with expertise across UX design, data engineering, back- and frontend development, cloud architecture, project management, AI, and automation. We work closely with tax specialists across the organization to develop custom software solutions, digital platforms, and data-driven tools that streamline tax processes and enhance decision-making while challenging the future of tax services. We are currently in a Nordic cluster process, merging the local country-specific Nordic teams into one Nordic Tax & Legal Technology team. We combine modern software development with advanced data analytics and AI to push the boundaries of what tax advisory services can be. This is your opportunity to be a part of delivering complex, high-impact systems in a fast-paced, collaborative environment while growing your career.


**Your key responsibilities**  

Your tasks will be varied; however, your primary responsibilities will include:


* Collaborate closely with Nordic KPMG project teams to execute client deployments of KPMG LINK Go, including hands-on configuration and troubleshooting
* Deploy, maintain and update KPMG LINK Go using JSON configuration files, ensuring settings and variables are optimized and aligned with customer requirements
* Run and support regular update cycles, coordinating and performing UAT in collaboration with KPMG project teams
* Utilize Visual Studio/VS Code and DevOps tools to manage, test, and deploy configurations
* Analyse and understand the downstream effects of configuration changes, proactively identifying and resolving issues
* Collaborate closely with Nordic colleagues and internal stakeholders to ensure seamless deployments and updates



The position is offered as a hybrid role, giving you the opportunity to work both from home and from our office in Malmö or Stockholm. Travel within the Nordic region is expected.


  
**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------

You are a technically minded business analyst with an understanding of platform configuration management and deployment. We imagine that you:


* Have 3–4 years of relevant experience, ideally at the Senior Consultant level, working with technical business analysis, configuration, or deployment
* Possess hands-on experience with json configuration files, Visual Studio/VS Code, and DevOps tools
* Thrive in a collaborative, cross-Nordic environment and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical colleagues
* Are familiar with the professional services industry and can adapt to changing priorities
* Are fluent in a Nordic language and English, both spoken and written
* Have domain knowledge within Mobility (an advantage, but not a requirement)

We are looking for candidates based in Malmö or Stockholm, with valid work visa permitting employment in Sweden.


**Do you want to make a difference with us?**  

If you are interested in becoming a Business Analyst in Nordic Tax & Legal Technology, please send us a motivated application via the link in the job advertisement. Please attach a cover letter, your CV, examination papers, and other relevant documents. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis, so we advise you to send your application as soon as possible.


If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Emil Aldershvile (Director Tax Technology) at emil.aldershvile@kpmg.com or +45 5077 0993


**About the company**
---------------------

At KPMG, we know that if we use and act on our insights together with the right people, we find opportunities everywhere. With 2000 employees in Sweden, Latvia and Lithuania, and a network of more than 265 000 experts in 143 countries across the globe, we are one of the world’s leading professional services firms.



We offer expertise within advisory, audit and tax and legal services to many of our region’s leading companies. We may support their organizational change, provide advice regarding risk and compliance, ESG reporting or development journeys, cyber threats, technology transformation, or finance strategy optimization. We also have experts within analysis, M&A and transactions, audit, tax and legal.

  

  

Enable "functional cookies" to watch the video
company_description: At KPMG, you'll be able to tap into your skills, expertise and passion to help organizations find sustainable solutions to the world's most pressing issues.

title: Business Analyst / Kravanalytiker
description:
Eskilstuna, Västerås


Business Analyst / Kravanalytiker


Job Description
Som **Business Analyst på Sogeti Västerås & Eskilstuna** blir du en nyckelspelare i att identifiera behov, analysera verksamhetsprocesser och driva förbättringar som gör verklig skillnad för våra kunder. Du hjälper verksamheter att lyckas med digitalisering genom att översätta mål och utmaningar till tydliga krav, smarta lösningar och konkreta förbättringsförslag.

**Intresserad?** Ansök i formuläret eller pinga oss direkt här: https://www.sogeti.se/ping-vasteras/

 **Om Sogeti Västerås & Eskilstuna**


På Sogeti arbetar vi nära våra kunder i Mälardalen och levererar lösningar som skapar verklig effekt i deras verksamheter. Här är du en del av ett starkt och stöttande lokalt team, samtidigt som du har tillgång till ett nationellt och globalt nätverk av specialister inom digitalisering, verksamhetsutveckling, AI och teknisk innovation.


Vi tror på att utvecklas tillsammans och satsar stort på kompetensutveckling, community-engagemang och kunskapsdelning. Och inte minst: vi värdesätter en **lokal och hållbar livsstil**. Vi bor i eller kring **Västerås och Eskilstuna**, nära både kontor, kollegor och våra kunders verksamheter.




**Din roll hos oss**


I den här rollen kommer du att:

* Kartlägga och analysera verksamhetsprocesser, behov och utmaningar för att identifiera digitaliseringsmöjligheter.
* Ta fram krav, lösningsunderlag och förbättringsförslag som är tydliga, realistiska och värdeskapande.
* Faciliterar workshops, intervjuer och analysmöten som engagerar och skapar samsyn hos verksamhetsrepresentanter.
* Arbeta nära produktägare, utvecklingsteam och andra specialister för att säkerställa att lösningar möter användarnas behov.
* Stötta kunder i att införa nya arbetssätt, digitala verktyg och datadrivna beslut som förbättrar vardagen för medarbetare och kunder.
* Bidra till att utveckla vårt lokal‑ och nationellt erbjudande inom digitalisering och verksamhetsanalys.
* Vara en del av ett inkluderande, prestigelöst och omtänksamt team där du kan vara dig själv och växa genom nya utmaningar.




**Hybridarbete**


På Sogeti erbjuder vi ett flexibelt arbetssätt.Du arbetar främst från våra kontor, hos kund eller hemifrån beroende på uppdrag och behov. Vi tror på **frihet under ansvar**, samtidigt som vi värdesätter närvaro, samarbete och en lokal förankring i Mälardalen. Du bor, eller planerar att flytta, till Västerås/Eskilstuna med omnejd och kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska.




**Om du blir erbjuden tjänsten**


Sedvanliga bakgrundskontroller ingår i rekryteringsprocessen enligt vår standard.




**Din bakgrund och erfarenhet**


Vi söker dig som har:

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta som Business Analyst, verksamhetsutvecklare eller kravanalytiker.
* Förmåga att förstå verksamhetens mål, problem och drivkrafter — och översätta dem till konkreta krav, rekommendationer och lösningsförslag.
* Vana av att kartlägga processer, analysera data och leda workshops och dialoger med olika intressenter.
* Ett starkt engagemang för att förbättra verksamheter genom digitalisering, smarta lösningar och användarcentrerat tänk.
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat, kommunicera tydligt och skapa förtroende i komplexa uppdrag.
* En vilja att fortsätta utvecklas, gärna genom kurser, certifieringar och community-engagemang.

 **Meriterande:**  

Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt, förändringsledning, UX-orienterad analys, kravmetodik, eller arbete med datadrivna förbättringar.

title: Product Manager
description:
### **Are you our next Product Manager?**


As a Product Manager, you will work closely with engineering, design, and data to continuously improve our storefront experience. This is a hands-on role with a strong focus on execution, delivery, and learning through iteration, working alongside an experienced e-commerce team.


You will take clear strategic direction and priorities and translate them into concrete product improvements. Over time, the role offers the opportunity to grow in scope and responsibility as you build context, product judgment, and ownership.


Your mission is to help make shopping with Photowall clearer, smoother, and more effective - from navigation to checkout - while learning what truly drives customer value in a high-impact e-commerce environment.


As a Product Manager you belong with the Product team in our Growth-department. The Product team consists of two developers and one product designer, and is being led by our Chief Growth Officer. You will of course work in close collaboration with both marketing and data teams, ensuring alignment across initiatives and leveraging insights to drive product decisions.

##### **Key Responsibilities**

* Own the execution of customer-facing product initiatives for the storefront
* Translate business priorities into clear product requirements and delivery plans
* Work closely with frontend developers and UX/design to deliver high-quality solutions
* Plan, run, and analyze A/B tests and experiments
* Use data and user insights to identify and prioritize improvements
* Coordinate multiple initiatives in parallel and ensure timely delivery
* Follow up after launch to measure impact, document learnings, and iterate

##### **Requirements**

* 4–6 years of experience as a Product Manager or Product Owner in digital products or e-commerce
* Proven ability to deliver end-to-end product improvements independently
* Experience working closely with engineering and design teams
* Experience creating detailed user stories and technical tickets for engineering teams
* Experience in e-commerce
* Analytical mindset, with experience using data, funnels, and experiment results
* Structured and reliable, with strong follow-through
* Familiarity with experimentation and analytics tools
* Interest in UX, personalization, and customer journey optimization

### **About Photowall**


At Photowall, we are more than just a global leader in custom-made wallpapers and wall murals -we’re passionate about transforming spaces and bringing design to life. With a presence in over 20 markets we’re on an exciting journey of growth. Our vision is to keep expanding, both geographically and through innovative new products. As proud members of the **Network of Design (NOD)**, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of interior design to create inspiring and meaningful spaces.


Here you’ll have the chance to shape our future and influence the development of our technical platform, all while working in a company that’s committed to the ever-evolving world of interior design. If you’re passionate about design and eager to grow, Photowall is the place for you. We can’t wait to welcome you aboard as a key player in our exciting journey!


Apply today and help us shape the future of design at Photowall!

title: E-commerce Director – Parental Leave Cover
description:
**About TOTEME**


TOTEME is a fashion house rooted in Swedish sensibilities, modern aspirations and the notion of style. With an appreciation for women’s many roles and how pieces are worn in practice, we create emblematic designs with an emphasis on materiality and shape. Representing a direct and decisive way of dressing, the collections are contextualized in curated edits, visuals and spaces.  

  

TOTEME was founded in 2014 by Elin Kling and Karl Lindman. From the atelier in Stockholm, we create collections spanning ready-to-wear, shoes, bags, accessories and jewelry.

**The Role**


TOTEME is looking for an E-commerce Director to join our team in Stockholm on parental leave cover from June 2026. As the E-commerce Director, you will be heading up the global E-commerce team at TOTEME, ensuring a commercially strong, innovative and on-brand e-commerce business. You will oversee the full customer journey from traffic acquisition, through conversion, site performance, front-end development, operations and innovation, to post-purchase experience, ensuring a locally relevant and scalable business. You will also oversee the development of our global marketplace business and be a key commercial stakeholder amongst Brand-Marketing & Communications teams. You will report to the Chief Commercial Officer.

**Responsibilities**

* Lead and develop the global e-commerce team consisting of fifteen employees, of which five are direct reports, across digital merchandising, performance marketing, e-commerce product, digital creative, operations and customer service
* Responsible for the global E-commerce P&L and Farfetch P&L
* Own and drive TOTEME’s global e-commerce strategy and roadmap, strengthening the brand’s position in the international digital fashion landscape
* Overall responsibility for the performance and continuous development of toteme.com, ensuring a premium, end-to-end luxury customer journey, as well as global marketplace (Farfetch) & affiliate performance
* Drive traffic growth and digital marketing performance in line with ROAS targets across global and local channels (paid social, SEO, SEM, paid shopping, Google, Meta, affiliates and local platforms)
* Ensure continuous development and optimization of e-commerce platforms and the e-com tech/app stack (Shopify, partner websites and apps) in collaboration with internal teams and external partners
* Deliver an on-brand on-site experience while optimizing conversion rates and reducing return rates through UX/UI development, testing and data-driven insights
* Lead locally relevant merchandising and shopping experiences across markets
* Be a key stakeholder in campaign and seasonal planning alongside Merchandising, Buying, Marketing and Brand
* Own the post-purchase experience, including delivery services, returns and customer service
* Manage the e-commerce budget, digital infrastructure and external partners to enable scalable, cost-efficient and high-quality global operations
* Participate in and contribute to TOTEME’s social and environmental sustainability strategy.

**Your Profile**

* Proven experience in delivering a cohesive, on-brand e-commerce experience within the luxury or premium designer fashion segment, with a strong understanding of how digital touchpoints strengthen the brand positioning and representation
* Leadership experience and the ability to inspire, motivate, and challenge teams, creating clarity, engagement, and commitment across functions and levels of the organisation.
* Proven commercial ownership of e-commerce performance, including revenue growth, profitability, and contribution to overall business targets.
* Experience setting and executing a long-term e-commerce strategy aligned with brand positioning and business growth.
* Deep understanding of key e-commerce areas such as traffic, conversion, site operations, site performance, front-end development and innovation
* Solid knowledge of e-commerce platforms and a good understanding of underlying IT architecture and integrations.
* Proven ability to lead cross-functionally and collaborate with both internal, and external stakeholders and team.
* Experience working with multibrand and online marketplaces, with the ability to manage and optimise third-party marketplace operations alongside a direct-to-consumer e-commerce business.

**About You**

* Solution-oriented and hands-on, with the ability to move seamlessly between strategic direction and operational execution.
* Commercially driven and results-focused, with a strong understanding of how e-commerce performance supports broader business objectives.
* Data-driven and digitally savvy, able to interpret insights and analytics to inform decisions, prioritisation, and continuous optimisation.
* Self-motivated, accountable, and confident in decision-making, with a strong sense of ownership.
* Innovation-led, with a proactive interest in exploring new technologies and ways of working to enhance performance and customer experience.

  

This is a parental leave cover for minimum 8 months from June 2026, with possible extension. It is a full-time position based at TOTEME's headquarters in Stockholm with start upon agreement.


TOTEME has teams in Stockholm, London, New York, and Shanghai, as well as retail spaces across Europe, North America, and Asia. As a member of our dynamic, creative, and highly collaborative team, you will take part in exciting projects and milestones, evolving within your role as you contribute to the company’s growth.


TOTEME stands for inclusivity and a sense of belonging in the workplace. We welcome all applicants and recruit on the basis of skills and experience.

*By applying to this position I agree with TOTEME’s privacy policy and to be contacted about future job opportunities for up to 2 years from the submission date. Find out more about our privacy policy* *here**.*

title: Product Manager – ActionableAgile Analytics
description:
#### **Who we are**


55 Degrees is a bootstrapped Swedish SaaS company with a growing, multicultural team. Based in the heart of Malmö, Sweden, we develop powerful applications that help teams worldwide work smarter and forecast better.


Our mission is to help organizations deliver more value with less stress by giving them the insights and tools they need to improve how work flows. We build software products that help teams make better decisions about their work in platforms like Jira, Azure DevOps, Trello, and more, and we’re proud to serve hundreds of customers globally.


We’re a team of curious, creative, and passionate individuals who believe in delivering exceptional products while maintaining a healthy balance in our lives. We value being happy at work and with our colleagues, and we ensure that work is as enjoyable as it is impactful!

##### **How we build product**


We aim to build in a way that is pragmatic, collaborative, and focused on learning and outcomes.

* We ship in small increments and learn quickly from real usage
* We validate problems through customer discovery and use data to guide decisions
* We prioritize clarity, usability, and quality over complexity
* We keep processes lightweight and focus on what helps the team deliver better outcomes
* We care about sustainable delivery — for both our customers and our team

#### **The role**


We’re hiring our **first Product Manager** to own our flagship flow metrics and forecasting product: **ActionableAgile Analytics.** This product helps customers improve delivery predictability, understand flow, and forecast outcomes without estimation.


This is a Product Manager role first and foremost. Your primary responsibility is product discovery, prioritization, and delivery outcomes — guiding the team toward shipping valuable improvements early and often.


You won’t be starting from scratch in this role. You’ll be joining an existing Product Designer who is already deeply involved in our products and also contributes in the product management domain. The two of you are expected to work as a tight duo — deliberately coordinating and dividing responsibilities across discovery, prioritization, and delivery — so that together you cover the full spectrum of product management and product design activities. You’ll collaborate closely with our Growth and Retention teams to ensure features are communicated clearly.


You'll report directly to one of our co-founders. English is our working language, and we are currently hiring **candidates located in Sweden**.

##### **Location**


Our office is located in Malmö, and we welcome both hybrid and remote candidates based in Sweden.


If you work remotely, we expect you to travel to the Malmö office a minimum of once per quarter for team collaboration and planning.

##### **What you’ll do**


As Product Manager, you’ll be accountable for the outcomes and quality of the products you own.


You will:

* Become a subject matter expert in flow metrics, forecasting, and the products you manage.
* Build a deep understanding of customer and user problems through research, data analysis, and regular interaction.
* Collaborate closely with engineering, design, and customer experience to define solutions and iterate quickly.
* Scope work into the smallest valuable increments to enable fast learning and frequent delivery.
* Define and track success metrics for releases across EAP, beta, and general availability.
* Use both qualitative and quantitative insights to guide prioritization (adoption, usage, retention signals, feedback).
* Ensure releases meet a high standard of quality, usability, and clarity.
* Communicate product decisions and plans clearly — internally and externally.
* Partner with Marketing and Customer Experience to ensure features are explained effectively across:


	+ product UI and messaging
	+ documentation and guides
	+ demos and collateral
* Maintain awareness of the competitive landscape and evolving market needs.
* Support customer interviews, visits, and occasional trade shows (as needed).

##### **What success looks like (first 6 months)**


A strong hire in this role will, within six months:

* Establish a consistent cadence of customer discovery (interviews, feedback loops, research synthesis).
* Build strong working relationships with engineering, design, and customer experience.
* Identify and clearly articulate 2–3 high-impact product opportunities backed by evidence.
* Ship meaningful improvements in small increments, learning quickly from real-world usage.
* Define and track success metrics that guide decision-making and reduce guesswork.
* Improve clarity and usability for customers through better UX and communication.
* Help strengthen how product decisions are made at 55 Degrees (lightweight, pragmatic processes).

#### **About you**


We’re not looking for a specific background so much as a strong product mindset and the ability to work end-to-end — from problem discovery to delivery and learning.


You’ll thrive here if you:

* Enjoy working in a bootstrapped, high-ownership environment.
* Prefer clarity and impact over heavy process and status meetings.
* Like balancing strategic thinking with hands-on execution.
* Are comfortable making decisions with imperfect information and learning quickly.
* Care deeply about usability and building products that reduce stress for real people.
* Want to help build product practices as the company grows.

##### **Your day one qualities**

* 2+ years experience as a Product Manager working on software products (SaaS preferred).
* Experience working in an agile environment, partnering closely with engineering teams.
* Strong skills in customer discovery and user research (interviews, testing, synthesis).
* Comfort working with data in systems like MixPanel — able to use metrics and qualitative insight together to make decisions.
* Strong product sense: ability to weigh tradeoffs and advocate for simple, intuitive UX.
* Strong communication skills: clear, structured storytelling in spoken and written English.
* A self-driven, entrepreneurial approach — you don’t wait for instructions and can operate with ambiguity.
* Experience producing product content such as documentation, presentations, or release communication.
* Degree or equivalent experience in Business, Computer Science, or related field.

##### **We’ll be excited if you**

* Experience with B2B products in the work management / agile / delivery / analytics space.
* Familiarity with Jira / Azure DevOps ecosystems.
* Understanding of forecasting, flow metrics, or operational analytics concepts.

#### **What we offer you**

* Hybrid-remote work
* Flexible hours
* 6 weeks prepaid vacation
* Occupational pension according to ITP plan
* Health insurance
* ‍️ Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK / year
* Bus/train ticket benefit for those who prefer to commute
* Breakfast & Fika - Crackers and fika are always close at hand
* ‍️ Volunteer days - 3 paid days off per year to volunteer for a charity of choice
* Join regular after works and happenings!
* Team spirit - become part of a tight and successful team
* An individual learning & development plan

#### **Apply Now!**

At 55 Degrees, you’ll join a small but highly skilled team where transparency, trust, and learning are part of everyday work. You’ll have real influence over the product, close collaboration with your peers, and the opportunity to help shape how product management evolves as we grow.


We interview on an ongoing basis and will fill the role as soon as we find the right match.

##### **Our hiring process**

**Contacts:**

* **Julia Wester**, Co-founder & Co-CEO, is the hiring manager and will lead the interviews.
* **Michelle Haglund**, Director of Operations, supports the process from an HR perspective and is available for any questions along the way.

**Our process looks like this:**

* **Remote competency-based interview**  

Your first conversation will be with Julia, focusing on your experience, how you collaborate, and mutual fit. We’ll go deep on one real product initiative you’ve led, how you made decisions, and what you personally drove.
* **Loop day**  

The final step is a loop day including:


	+ A practical, hands-on session based on a realistic product exercise.
	+ Meetings with several team members you’ll collaborate closely with.
	+ This is also your opportunity to get a deeper feel for our culture, ways of working, and people.


If you have practical or process-related questions, feel free to reach out to Michelle at michelle@55degrees.se

title: Director, Product Design
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 175,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch’s Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.  



Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.  



At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple”, and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation!  



**About the role**

As LLMs and agent-driven technologies redefine how products are built and experienced, customer expectations are changing at an unprecedented pace. To navigate this transformation and elevate the Build platform to its full potential, we are establishing a Director of Product Design role to be the leader that will define and drive the vision, strategy, and end-to-end experience of the Sinch Build Portal—the gateway to our global B2C communications platform.  



This role is responsible for shaping the product design experience end-to-end, evolving the Build ecosystem into a cohesive, intuitive, and scalable platform that empowers users to explore, configure, and manage Sinch APIs. The world is becoming agentic, and we are looking for a person who is as passionate as us about how this changes everything, from user experience to tooling, while standing firm on current realities.  



As the design leader for Build, you’ll drive the long-term UX strategy across multiple product surfaces, mentor and grow a global design team, and partner with cross-functional leaders to elevate to evolve the Build ecosystem, ensuring every interaction feels cohesive, empowering, and distinctly Sinch.  



**Responsibilities**

* Own and articulate the long-term UX strategy for the Build Portal and its connected areas, ensuring a unified, scalable, and discoverable experience across the entire customer journey.
* Establish the connective tissue between Build domains, documentation, onboarding, activation, and usage workflows to ensure experiences scale effectively for both Enterprise-managed and Self-serve customers.
* Mentor, empower, and grow the Build product design team direct reports, fostering a culture of learning, curiosity, and continuous improvement.
* Represent UX in strategic Build planning, advocating for quality and user value while partnering with Product and Engineering leadership to deliver cohesive, end-to-end customer experiences.
* Establish UX product design excellence within the team and in collaboration with the product and engineering teams, including user research, prototyping, customer validation, data driven (qualitative and quantitive)
Lead the transition into modern LLM powered tools and ways of working in the product design process  
* 

The role is based at SINCH HQ in Stockholm, Sweden and report to the Senior Director, Product Design.  



**About you**

* 10+ years of experience designing SaaS, CPaaS, or developer-focused products, including experience leading multi-product ecosystems.
* Proven leadership experience managing designers or leading design across complex product surfaces.
* A track record of translating a multi-product vision into structured, scalable UX strategies.
* Expertise in Figma, design systems, and accessibility best practices, and showcase how the AI shift has been applied within these tools.
* Demonstrated ability to influence senior partners, drive alignment, and build strong cross-functional relationships.
Strong communication skills and the ability to simplify complexity for technical audiences.  
* 

**Big plus:**

* Background in UX regarding communications, messaging, CPaaS, or developer tooling.
* Experience designing for both Enterprise and Self-serve user segments in a unified product.
Experience with API product lifecycles, configuration workflows, and developer documentation is desirable.  
* 

Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in **English** .  



At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation at this time.  



Applicants must:


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.

**Our hiring process**

We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.


We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/ . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.

title: UI/UX Design Intern (unpaid)
description:
UI/UX Design Intern (unpaid)
 



 Location: Remote
 



 Type: Unpaid Internship
 



 Start Date: Immediate
 



 Duration: 3-6 months (Flexible, Part-Time or Full-Time)
 







 About This Opportunity
 



 Join Gaddr, an early-stage AI startup focused on reimagining productivity and task intelligence. We’re seeking a motivated UX/UI Design Intern to help shape our platform’s visual identity and user experience. If you’re passionate about designing intuitive interfaces and creating products that delight users, this is your chance to gain hands-on experience in a fast-moving startup environment.
 







 Key Responsibilities
 


* Assist in designing user flows, wireframes, and high-fidelity prototypes for Gaddr's web and mobile platforms.
* Contribute to the development of a cohesive design system that supports scalability and consistency.
* Collaborate with developers and product managers to translate user needs into thoughtful design solutions.
* Conduct basic usability testing and incorporate feedback into iterative design improvements.
* Support the creation of visuals, icons, and micro-interactions that enhance overall user experience.







 What We’re Looking For
 


* Currently studying or recently graduated in UX/UI Design, Interaction Design, Digital Media, or related field.
* Familiarity with Figma, Adobe XD, or similar design tools.
* A portfolio or case studies that demonstrate creative thinking and attention to detail.
* Eagerness to learn and adapt in a collaborative, cross-functional environment.
* Strong communication skills and openness to feedback.
* Must be fluent in English (written and spoken).



  









 What You’ll Gain
 


* Hand-son experience designing real-world digital products for a growing AI startup.
* Mentorship and feedback from experienced designers and founders.
* Exposure to user-centered design processes and agile collaboration.
* A chance to expand your portfolio with impactful projects.
* Flexible remote working hours tailored to your schedule.







 Commitment: minimum of 15-20 hours/week
 



 Duration: 3-6 month
 







 Please Note:
 



 This is an unpaid internship, ideal for students or early-career designers looking to gain meaningful experience in a real-world startup environment.
 







 How to Apply
 



 If this sounds like the perfect fit, we’d love to hear from you! Send us:
 



 1) Your resume (in English)
 



 2) A link to your portfolio or sample design work
 







 Apply directly via LinkedIn or email your application to team@gaddr.com

title: UX Designer
description:
Decernos Designstudio växer och vi söker nu en erfaren UX-designer som vill ta ett helhetsansvar för användarupplevelsen i komplexa, samhällsnyttiga digitala lösningar.
   

  

 Som UX-designer på Decerno kommer du att få arbeta med hela design-processen, allt i från strategi och förbättring av användarupplevelse till implementering av design. Arbetet kan bland annat innebära research, kravhantering, interaktionsdesign, UI, facilitera workshops och prompta prototyper.
   

  

 Hos oss får du en central roll som UX-designer där du ofta är den drivande UX-kompetensen i ett tvärfunktionellt team. Genom Designstudion får du samtidigt kontinuerligt stöd, erfarenhetsutbyte och möjlighet att utvecklas tillsammans med andra designers.
   

  

 Rollen är placerad i Stockholm och vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsform. Vi tror på att kunna erbjuda våra medarbetare flexibilitet och möjligheten att balansera egna behov och förutsättningar med projektets krav. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Vad gör vi?**
 Vi på Decerno är specialister på skräddarsydda digitala lösningar och är stolta över att våra uppdrag bidrar till samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Det betyder att vi förstår att alla kunder är olika och har unika förutsättningar. Vi skräddarsyr våra lösningar utefter kundens behov vilket medför att våra medarbetare får möjlighet att arbeta i varierande och spännande projekt med olika tekniker.
   

  

 Samtidigt som vi skapar digitala lösningar vill vi också göra skillnad på riktigt. Det är inte bara något vi säger, vi menar det! Sedan vår start 1984 har vår etiska policy varit vår kompass och vi väljer aktivt bort projekt inom vapenindustri, spel om pengar, tobak och alkohol.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Vi tror att du är en erfaren UX-designer som kombinerar ett starkt hantverk med nyfikenhet och ansvar. Du har flera års erfarenhet av UX-arbete i komplexa sammanhang och använder AI-verktyg som en naturlig del av din designprocess. Du trivs i tvärfunktionella team där du bidrar med både struktur och dialog.
   

  

 Du har:
   

  

* Minst fyra års arbetslivserfarenhet av UX-design
* Väldigt goda kunskaper i Figma
* Kunskap om att designa för tillgänglighet och inkluderande användarupplevelser
* Vana av att facilitera workshops och leda samskapande aktiviteter
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med stora och komplexa lösningar
* Erfarenhet av att använda AI som stöd genom hela designprocessen, från research till prototyp
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift


 Som person är du utforskande och vågar ifrågasätta antaganden, samtidigt som du är nyfiken på affären och hur nya metoder, verktyg och AI kan skapa bättre lösningar. Du är kommunikativ och fungerar som en brobyggare mellan användare, teknik och affär samt anpassar din kommunikation efter mottagare och situation. Du trivs i föränderliga miljöer där allt inte är definierat från start och tar ett tydligt ansvar för att lösningar håller hög kvalitet och är användbara, hållbara och inkluderande – i både process och slutresultat.
   

  

**Därför ska du välja Decerno**
 I våra medarbetarundersökningar blir det gång på gång tydligt att det är de fantastiska kollegorna, de roliga och utmanande projekten och möjligheten att kunna bidra till samhällsnytta som gör att våra medarbetare trivs så bra på Decerno.
   

  

 Sedan finns det också några ytterligare aspekter vilka vi ser som självklarheter:
   

  

* En flexibel arbetsplats med större frihet att planera vardagen för att få arbete och privatliv att gå ihop
* Extra föräldraförmåner eftersom vi tycker att familjen är viktigast
* Ett fräscht nybyggt kontor i Stockholm med tillgång till eget gym, garage, cykelgarage och takterrass
* Vi tycker att din kompetensutveckling är viktig! Därför anordnar vi interna utbildningar löpande i vår egen Dec Academy, gör satsningar inom AI, håller i bokcirklar och arrangerar årliga konferenser
* Vi vill att du ska må bra, trivas och ha roligt på arbetet och därför arrangerar vi regelbundet olika sociala aktiviteter, utmaningar och hälsotävlingar – såväl virtuellt som på plats


 Utöver detta erbjuder vi även ett brett förmånspaket som inkluderar bland annat friskvårdsbidrag och ett generöst försäkringspaket.
   

  

**Låter detta som ditt nästa steg i karriären?**
 Vad kul! Skicka in din ansökan eller hör av dig om du vill veta mer om rollen eller Designstudion – vi berättar gärna.

title: Staff Product Designer, Merchant Team
description:
Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to home or to the office. Our local commerce platform makes it easy for customers to order whatever they need on one app, for merchants to make additional sales, and for couriers to make meaningful earnings flexibly. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local commerce platform to retail software and financial solutions, as well as operates its own grocery stores under the brand Wolt Market. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 27 countries today, 23 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

  





*Wolt not only offers great apps to customers and partners, but is also developing a broad range of technologies and solutions. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest reviews, largely because of our customer-centric approach to how we build our products and operations. For example, our customer service team responds in a matter of minutes, in the customer’s own language.*




***So, why work at Wolt?***




*At Wolt, we’re about getting things done.*




*You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people. We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.*




*The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.*




***Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion***




*We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.*




*Join us today to build Wolt together.*



**Job Description**

 We are looking for a
 **Staff Product Designer to join the Merchant Mission!** 
 The Merchant Group focuses on making Wolt an integral part of our Merchants’ daily lives in all the 25+ countries Wolt is active in. We provide our business partners with tools and automations that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use. Our products are built around self-service, which helps us keep trust at the core of our partner relationships.
   

  

  





 This will be someone who has mastered the craft of turning insights into beautifully designed products, who can inspire organisations through prototyping and storytelling to ensure their final work has maximum impact for the customer.
   

  

  





**📍** 
 This role can be based in
 **Stockholm** 
 .
   

  

  

  

  




**Our humble expectations**

**You’re a great fit for this role if you:**



* Drive strategic initiatives and shape broad direction of design
* Operate as a thought leader, communicating and advocating for design decisions across teams and with senior stakeholders, often influencing company-wide decisions
* Handle highly ambiguous and complex problems that require broader perspective, cross functional collaboration, and long term thinking
* Can take products from 0 to 1, from conception to delivery
* Design end to end, with focus on rapid prototyping and UI, crafting visually delightful experiences
* Thrive in a fast-paced organisation
* Are curious about new AI technologies and how we can use them in design



**What you’ll do:**



* **Listen carefully.** 
 The better you understand our users problems the better your solutions will be. It’s important for us to know we are solving for real people and not just the loudest voice in the room.
* **Collaborate across teams.** 
 You’ll partner closely with product, engineering, and business folks to find elegant but practical solutions to design challenges. You’ll provide the thought leadership to inspire and develop the right design direction. Together, you’ll solve problems and come up with solutions that delight our users.
* **Imagine the way forward.** 
 You’ll take full ownership of your work, and be responsible for every last detail, every step of the way.



**Who you are:**



* **Experience.** 
 You’ve been designing for
 **10+ years** 
 (app and desktop) for a consumer-focused tech company , so understand what it takes to create elegant, consumer-oriented experiences.
* **Mastery.** 
 You are a versatile t-shaped designer who uses a full range of skills—product design, interaction design, and visual design—to ensure you deliver magical experiences to the user.
* **You’re a strong communicator.** 
 You can inspire teams towards action and empathy for the user.
* **You have a people-focused design mentality.** 
 Constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback. Whether that’s hands-on user research or a quantitative A/B test.



  

  

  

  

  




**Next Steps**

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so feel free to apply as soon as you feel like hearing more about the position and potentially joining Wolt! Please kindly make sure to include your portfolio with your application.
   

  

  





 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you'll own a piece of the pie.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re hiring
 **Senior Product Designers at Wolt Design** 
 across several exciting product areas:
   

  

* Consumer – You'll shape the core experience that millions of users rely on daily to discover, order, and enjoy their favorite meals and essentials—delivering delight at every tap.
* Merchant – You’ll build tools that help local businesses succeed on the Wolt platform, from order management to insights and growth levers—empowering merchants at scale.
* Courier – You’ll design experiences for the people who make Wolt run—our courier partners. From onboarding to daily logistics, your work will help make every delivery seamless.
* Central – You’ll create the systems, platforms, and tools that power Wolt behind the scenes—unlocking scale, speed, and smarter decisions across the company.


 Each team offers a chance to tackle unique design challenges with real-world impact.
   

  

 📍The roles are based in our tech hub in Berlin or Stockholm.
   

  

 You’re excited about this opportunity because:
   

  

* You care deeply about creating experiences that empower businesses and improve everyday life for merchants, couriers, and consumers.
* You lead with empathy, always designing with the user in mind.
* You thrive in complex, ambiguous problem spaces—and enjoy bringing structure, clarity, and direction.
* You hold a high bar for your craft, from concept to pixel—creating designs that are scalable, thoughtful, and beautiful.


 What you’ll be doing:
   

  

* Turn ambiguity into clarity. You’ll bring strong framing and product thinking to shape undefined problems into compelling design opportunities.
* Bring ideas to life beautifully. You’ll design intuitive interfaces and interactions that are both delightful and highly usable.
* Prototype to inspire. Through prototyping, storytelling, and systems thinking, you’ll align teams and build momentum—ensuring your work not only ships, but resonates.
* Own the full design stack. From strategy and exploration to refined visuals, you’ll lead high-impact initiatives from start to finish.


 Who you are:
   

  

 We’d love to work with you if:
   

  

* You have 6+ years of experience designing consumer, B2B, or SaaS products—building elegant, business-savvy solutions in complex environments.
* You’re a T-shaped designer with deep strengths in concepting, visual design and prototyping, able to drive high-quality outcomes in a collaborative, cross-functional team.
* You think in systems, not just screens—comfortable designing across diverse journeys and touchpoints.
* You’re a creative problem-solver, excited by ambiguity and energized by complex design challenges.
* You’re open to feedback—comfortable sharing early, learning fast, and evolving ideas with your team.
* You’re a strong communicator and natural storyteller, able to align stakeholders, build empathy, and drive design-led decisions.


 What’s next:
   

  

 As a next step, we’d love to see your
 **portfolio** 
 to better understand your design approach and impact. We’re especially interested in work that shows
 **strong visual craft** 
 ,
 **attention to detail** 
 , and
 **real results** 
 . One well-structured Figma file with your best, recent work is more valuable to us than multiple outdated case studies — products move fast, and relevance matters. If you have
 **high-fidelity prototypes** 
 or
 **motion work** 
 , even better. We're excited to see how you think and build. Please read this article for more info on how to build your folio!
   

  

 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P4gfa-m4SfM
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Product Manager
description:
Are you our next Product Manager?
   

  

 As a Product Manager, you will work closely with engineering, design, and data to continuously improve our storefront experience. This is a hands-on role with a strong focus on execution, delivery, and learning through iteration, working alongside an experienced e-commerce team.
   

  

 You will take clear strategic direction and priorities and translate them into concrete product improvements. Over time, the role offers the opportunity to grow in scope and responsibility as you build context, product judgment, and ownership.
   

  

 Your mission is to help make shopping with Photowall clearer, smoother, and more effective - from navigation to checkout - while learning what truly drives customer value in a high-impact e-commerce environment.
   

  

 As a Product Manager you belong with the Product team in our Growth-department. The Product team consists of two developers and one product designer, and is being led by our Chief Growth Officer. You will of course work in close collaboration with both marketing and data teams, ensuring alignment across initiatives and leveraging insights to drive product decisions.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities****
* Own the execution of customer-facing product initiatives for the storefront
* Translate business priorities into clear product requirements and delivery plans
* Work closely with frontend developers and UX/design to deliver high-quality solutions
* Plan, run, and analyze A/B tests and experiments
* Use data and user insights to identify and prioritize improvements
* Coordinate multiple initiatives in parallel and ensure timely delivery
* Follow up after launch to measure impact, document learnings, and iterate


**Requirements**
* 4–6 years of experience as a Product Manager or Product Owner in digital products or e-commerce
* Proven ability to deliver end-to-end product improvements independently
* Experience working closely with engineering and design teams
* Experience creating detailed user stories and technical tickets for engineering teams
* Experience in e-commerce
* Analytical mindset, with experience using data, funnels, and experiment results
* Structured and reliable, with strong follow-through
* Familiarity with experimentation and analytics tools
* Interest in UX, personalization, and customer journey optimization


**About Photowall**
 At Photowall, we are more than just a global leader in custom-made wallpapers and wall murals -we’re passionate about transforming spaces and bringing design to life. With a presence in over 20 markets we’re on an exciting journey of growth. Our vision is to keep expanding, both geographically and through innovative new products. As proud members of the
 **Network of Design (NOD)** 
 , we are constantly pushing the boundaries of interior design to create inspiring and meaningful spaces.
   

  

 Here you’ll have the chance to shape our future and influence the development of our technical platform, all while working in a company that’s committed to the ever-evolving world of interior design. If you’re passionate about design and eager to grow, Photowall is the place for you. We can’t wait to welcome you aboard as a key player in our exciting journey!
   

  

 Apply today and help us shape the future of design at Photowall!

title: Insights & Nudging Specialist
description:
**Job Description**

 We are on an evolution journey to simplify, connect, and strengthen our core people processes. As part of this journey, we are hiring a behavioral
 **Insights & Nudging Specialist** 
 to help turn data into actionable insights that support engagement, growth, and performance across our organization.
   

  





 This role sits within our People Lifecycle – Contribute & Grow team and focuses on building a common approach to reporting, dashboards, and insights across development, transitions, contribution, growth, and leadership. In close collaboration with specialists across the area, the role also supports the design and implementation of data-driven nudges that encourage meaningful behaviour change.
   

  





 As a behavioral Insights & Nudging Specialist, you will work closely with specialists and experts across Contribute & Grow, as well as Digital and Employee Listening, to design and evolve reporting and analytics frameworks that support both strategic decision-making and everyday leadership actions.
   

  





 You will focus on insight generation, analytics frameworks, data quality, and behavioural nudges, ensuring leaders, HR, and teams have access to clear, meaningful insights that drive action. Your work will enable a consolidated view of progress across the people lifecycle while supporting continuous improvement of processes and experiences.
   

  





**WHAT YOU’LL DO**




 Insights, Reporting, and Data Foundations
   

  




* Co-create and maintain a consistent approach to reporting, analytics frameworks, and KPIs across Contribute & Grow areas.
* Build and maintain a consolidated view of progress and key metrics that supports strategic priorities, follow-up, and alignment.
* Partner with Digital and specialist areas to ensure data quality, consistency, and reliability across systems, dashboards, and reports.



 Insight Generation and Decision Support
   

  




* Translate data into clear, actionable insights that support decision-making at team, HR, and manager levels.
* Develop insights that measure experience quality, adoption, and effectiveness across key people processes such as onboarding, contribution, talent reviews, and leadership programs.



 Behavioural Nudging and Action
   

  




* Co-design data-driven nudges that make it easier for employees, managers and HR to adopt the right practices and act at the right time.
* Connect insights to clear actions and moments that matter to support meaningful behaviour change.



 Continuous Improvement and Storytelling
   

  




* Gather feedback on dashboards, reports, and insights to continuously improve clarity, usability, and business impact.
* Package and present insights in a simple, visual, and engaging way that builds understanding and drives action.



**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**




 You will collaborate closely with specialists and experts across Development, Transitions, Contribution & Growth, Leadership & Talent, Employee Listening, and Digital. You will work in a highly cross-functional environment where alignment, data quality, and shared understanding are critical to success.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE**



* We are looking for someone who is analytical, curious, and motivated by turning data into insight and action.
* You enjoy working at the intersection of people, data, and decision-making, and you are comfortable translating complex information into clear messages that support leaders and HR in their work. You understand that insights only create value when they are relevant, trusted, and connected to real decisions and behaviours.
* You bring experience working with data, analytics, reporting, or insights in a people, HR, or business context, and you enjoy partnering across teams to define what matters and how it should be measured. You are structured and detail-oriented, while also able to see patterns, trends, and the bigger picture.
* You are comfortable collaborating with other specialists to secure data quality, consistency, and integration across systems. You communicate clearly, think visually, and enjoy shaping insights that are easy to understand and act on.
* You have experience with dashboards, reporting tools, analytics frameworks, behavioral nudging is an advantage. (i.e. SQL, Python, R, Power BI, etc.)


**Additional Information**

**WHO WE ARE** 
 ​
   

  





 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.​
   

  





 ​We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. ​
   

  





**​WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
 ​
   

  





 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  





 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  





**JOIN US​** 
  

  





 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.​
   

  





 ​Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.​
   

  





 ​
 *\*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.​*

title: Staff Product Designer
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The role**
 At Legora, we’re building the category-defining AI product for legal work. As a Staff Product Designer, you’ll operate at the highest level of our design org. You’ll shape how the entire product fits together, drive strategy for our most complex problem spaces, and set the standard for design quality across the company.
   

  

 You’ll partner directly with leadership in design, product, and engineering to define where we’re going, while still rolling up your sleeves to deliver best-in-class interaction and visual design. This is a role for a designer who thrives on solving hard problems and multiplying the impact of the whole team.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Lead design across multiple product areas, ensuring coherence and clarity at the system level.
* Shape product strategy: frame the hardest problems, influence roadmaps, and push for bold but practical solutions.
* Set and evolve the quality bar for design craft, accessibility, and usability across Legora’s product.
* Partner with engineering and product leadership to make tradeoffs that preserve experience while shipping fast.
* Explore entirely new product directions, from zero-to-one ideas to scaled launches.


**Who You Are**
* Extensive product design experience with a track record of shipping complex, high-impact products.
* Exceptional craft in interaction and visual design, combined with the ability to connect details to strategy.
* Comfortable working in complex domains and navigating ambiguous problem spaces.
* Skilled at moving seamlessly between hands-on design and high-level product thinking.
* Strong communication skills: you inspire confidence across product, engineering, and leadership.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Senior CRO & Personalization Manager
description:
Looking for a workplace for the future? At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you'll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most - relationships between people? Then you are welcome to Telenor.
 



  





**How you'll make a difference with us** 




 As Senior CRO & Personalization Manager, you will lead our end-to-end optimization and personalization strategy across digital sales touchpoints for our B2C customers. Your mission is to increase conversion, engagement, and customer lifetime value by delivering frictionless, relevant, and tailored experiences throughout the subscription journey.
 



  





 You will combine experimentation expertise with data-driven personalization to create dynamic user experiences that respond to customer needs, behaviors, and lifecycle stages. Working closely with UX design, analytics, product, engineering, and marketing teams, you will build a scalable testing and personalization framework that continuously improves sales outcomes across acquisition, upgrade, and retention flows.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Lead the strategy, roadmap, and execution for CRO and personalization across all digital sales channels.
* Identify high-impact opportunities through behavioral analysis, segmentation, funnel diagnostics, and customer insights.
* Drive A/B and multivariate testing, personalization rules, and audience-based experiences.
* Implement personalization use cases across landing pages, product selection, checkout, and logged-in experiences.
* Develop a scalable experimentation culture, including prioritization models, documentation, and shared learning processes.
* Collaborate with marketing to align personalization with lifecycle campaigns and traffic strategies.
* Partner with product and engineering to ensure personalization logic and experimentation tools integrate smoothly into the tech stack.
* Track and report on the impact of optimization and personalization initiatives on key KPIs such as conversion, sales, churn, customer lifetime value and higher digital engagement for service errands.



  





**Experience & Background** 



* 6+ years in CRO, personalization, digital growth, or related roles.
* Proven ability to improve conversion rates and revenue through structured testing and advanced personalization strategies.
* Experience in subscription-based digital businesses; telco experience is a strong advantage.
* Background in working with cross-functional teams within digital product and sales environments.



  





**Skills** 



* Deep expertise in A/B testing, experimentation frameworks, and funnel optimization.
* Hands-on experience with personalization platforms (e.g., Dynamic Yield, Optimizely Personalization, Adobe Target, similar).
* Very strong analytical capabilities including segmentation, cohort analysis, and behavioral insights.
* Good understanding of customer data platforms (CDPs), tagging, and data layer concepts.
* Ability to translate insights into clear hypotheses, test designs, and optimization roadmaps.
* Solid understanding of UX/UI principles and how they influence behavior and conversion.
* Skilled in collaborating with product owners, developers, designers, and analysts.
* Can read and understand HTML, CSS, JavaScript, as well as able to make small front-end changes in testing tools and troubleshoot broken variations or selectors without relying on developers.
* Has understanding of DOM structure, dataLayer usage, and how personalization payloads are injected



  





**Personal Competencies** 



* Hypothesis-driven thinker with excellent prioritization skills.
* Strong communicator capable of influencing stakeholders at all levels.
* Comfortable leading discussions around data, strategy, and technical implications.
* Curious, experimental mindset focused on continuous learning and improvement.
* Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously.



  





**Our promise to you** 




**We are better together.** 




 Here, you'll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other's backs through ups and downs.
 



  





**We support relationships and societies.** 




 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
 



  





**We make room for life.** 




 Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. Leadership based on trust and flexible working hours helps you balance work and life. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.
 



  





**We invite you to a career in motion.** 




 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you'll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. If you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
 



  





**Apply today!** 




 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don't wait-reach out today.
 



 In this recruitment, Telenor collaborates with Experis IT, which has extensive experience in recruiting IT specialists and managers. If you have any questions or need more information, please contact Recruitment Consultant Carina Eyoma at carina.eyoma@se.experis.com, +46 73-086 22 75.
 



 Please note that we cannot accept applications via email.
 



  





**Good to know** 




 As part of Telenor's policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Are you our next Product Manager?** 




  





 As a Product Manager, you will work closely with engineering, design, and data to continuously improve our storefront experience. This is a hands-on role with a strong focus on execution, delivery, and learning through iteration, working alongside an experienced e-commerce team. 
 



  





 You will take clear strategic direction and priorities and translate them into concrete product improvements. Over time, the role offers the opportunity to grow in scope and responsibility as you build context, product judgment, and ownership. 
 



 Your mission is to help make shopping with Photowall clearer, smoother, and more effective - from navigation to checkout - while learning what truly drives customer value in a high-impact e-commerce environment. 
 



  





 As a Product Manager you belong with the Product team in our Growth-department. The Product team consists of two developers and one product designer, and is being led by our Chief Growth Officer. You will of course work in close collaboration with both marketing and data teams, ensuring alignment across initiatives and leveraging insights to drive product decisions.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Own the execution of customer-facing product initiatives for the storefront
* Translate business priorities into clear product requirements and delivery plans
* Work closely with frontend developers and UX/design to deliver high-quality solutions
* Plan, run, and analyze A/B tests and experiments
* Use data and user insights to identify and prioritize improvements
* Coordinate multiple initiatives in parallel and ensure timely delivery
* Follow up after launch to measure impact, document learnings, and iterate



  





**Requirements** 



* 4–6 years of experience as a Product Manager or Product Owner in digital products or e-commerce
* Proven ability to deliver end-to-end product improvements independently
* Experience working closely with engineering and design teams
* Experience creating detailed user stories and technical tickets for engineering teams
* Experience in e-commerce
* Analytical mindset, with experience using data, funnels, and experiment results
* Structured and reliable, with strong follow-through
* Familiarity with experimentation and analytics tools
* Interest in UX, personalization, and customer journey optimization



  





**About Photowall** 




 At Photowall, we are more than just a global leader in custom-made wallpapers and wall murals -we’re passionate about transforming spaces and bringing design to life. With a presence in over 20 markets we’re on an exciting journey of growth. Our vision is to keep expanding, both geographically and through innovative new products. As proud members of the
 **Network of Design (NOD)** 
 , we are constantly pushing the boundaries of interior design to create inspiring and meaningful spaces.
 



  





 Here you’ll have the chance to shape our future and influence the development of our technical platform, all while working in a company that’s committed to the ever-evolving world of interior design. If you’re passionate about design and eager to grow, Photowall is the place for you. We can’t wait to welcome you aboard as a key player in our exciting journey!
 



  





 Apply today and help us shape the future of design at Photowall!

title: UI Testautomatisering Ingenjör till B3 Mobile
description:
***Att vakna på morgonen med längtan att gå till jobbet!***
 B3 Mobile är dotterbolaget inom koncernen som är
 ***experter***
 på apputveckling. UI-testning, iOS, Android, Kotlin, Swift, Java - Vi kan det!
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär. Du kanske har arbetat med automatiserade UI tester i några år och känner dig redo för något nytt. Håll i hatten, för hos B3 Mobile arbetar vi med några av världens mest spännande kunder baserade både i Stockholm och på andra sidan Atlanten.
   

  

 I rollen som UI Test Automation Engineer kommer du att arbeta tillsammans med ett kompetent och passionerat gäng utvecklare, UX-designers och projektledare både in-house och ute hos kund.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som:**
* Är civilingenjör eller motsvarande
* Besitter goda kunskaper i Svenska, både i tal & skrift
* Har 3+ års erfarenhet som UI Test Automation Engineer/QA Tester
* Har stor erfarenhet av att UI-testa native Android- och iOS-applikationer
* Besitter goda kunskaper inom mjukvarautveckling, inklusive förmågan att skriva, felsöka och underhålla kod i vanliga programmeringsspråk som C#, Java, JavaScript eller Python
* Har goda kunskaper i något UI-test automatiseringstestverktyg som tex Appium, Selenium, Cypress och eventuellt Robot Framework
* Har kunskaper och erfarenhet av CI/CD-processer och metoder
* Är proaktiv och kommer med förslag på lösningar inom de projekt du arbetar med
