title: Design Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The role**
 We’re hiring a Design Engineer to help us build the most beautiful and intuitive legal platform in the world. You’ll work across the gap between design and frontend—crafting polished, interactive experiences that make AI feel natural, collaborative, and human. Your job is to bring clarity, motion, and refinement to every corner of the interface.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Build elegant, reusable UI with React, TypeScript, and CSS
* Translate Figma designs into refined, real product experiences
* Prototype and explore new interaction patterns—especially around AI workflows
* Add motion and micro-interactions that bring interfaces to life
* Shape our design system alongside designers and engineers
* Raise the visual and interaction quality across the product


**Who You Are**
* Strong experience with React, TypeScript, and modern CSS
* Deep interest in UI design, motion, and detail
* A portfolio that shows taste, craft, and interaction thinking
* Curiosity about how AI changes the way people interact with software
* Drive to build interfaces that are fast to use and delightful to use


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Description**
 Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

 SSC also has one of the world’s largest global networks of ground stations for satellite communications. We own and operate the Esrange Space Center in Kiruna,
   

  

 northern Sweden, with the aim of launching satellites in the near future.
   

  

 Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace?
   

  

 Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help Earth benefit from space?
   

  

 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as a Software Engineer in our team. We are looking for a dedicated person who shares our core values of Customer passion, Care, Collaboration, Curiosity, and Courage.
   

  

**Requirements**
 YOUR ROLE
   

  

 At SSC Connect we enable global satellite communication, and you will be part of the Software unit that makes it happen.
   

  

 As our Software Engineer, you’ll develop and maintain the critical systems that keep our customers connected with their satellites every day.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design, build andmaintainhigh-quality code for new and existing software applications powering SSC’s services.
* Improve automation for software testing,deploymentand delivery pipelines.
* Enhance system observability by developing solutions for monitoring,loggingand alerting.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our agile ways of working.
* Support live missions and ensure the operational reliability of our systems.


**Responsibilities**
 WHO YOU ARE
   

  

 You are someone who cares about your systems, your users and your colleagues.
   

  

 You have a creative yet structured mindset, and you’re motivated by solving complex problems and finding efficient solutions. You’re comfortable taking initiatives, working both independently and collaboratively, and you enjoy transforming ideas into robust and scalable solutions.
   

  

 We believe you have a BSc or similar degree in Computer Science or Engineering and several years of experience in software development.
   

  

 To succeed in this role, you should have:
   

  

* Solid knowledge of Linux environments.
* Proven experience in C++.
* Excellent communication skills in English.


 We also value if you have:
   

  

* Experience in Python and/or Go.
* Experience with Docker.
* Experience building scalable and reliable infrastructure on cloud platforms.
* Experience with message bus technologies.
* Experience with databases (SQL).
* Interest or experience within the space industry.


 Additional information:
   

  

 Due to the high security classification of this role, EU citizenship is required and a background check will be conducted prior to employment.
   

  

 This role is critical to SSC’s operational services and may include participation in an on-call rotation (up to one week per month).
   

  

**Benefits**
 LOCATION
   

  

 This is a full time, permanent position based in Solna or Kiruna, with a hybrid work model requiring three days per week at the office.
   

  

 WE OFFER YOU
   

  

* A unique opportunity to contribute to a wide range of projects and play an active role in both the Swedish and international space industry.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An exciting, international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.


**Additional Benefits**
* In addition to vacation and traditional public holidays, we offer extra paid leave throughout the year, such as time off between Christmas and New Year, Ascension Day, amounting to 6-11 extra days depending on the calendar.
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year.
* Health benefits such as voluntary health insurance and regular health checks for eligible employees.
* Access to a benefit bike through a tax-efficient leasing program.
* Support for employee-driven activities that promote connection, health, and culture across teams.
* Collective Agreement, including good pensions plans, parental pay and insurance.


 FURTHER INFORMATION
   

  

 For questions regarding employment terms or union-related matters, you are welcome to contact our union representatives:
   

  

 Sveriges Ingenjörer: SverigesIngenjorer-AF@sscspace.com
   

  

 Unionen: unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

  

  

 NEXT STEP
   

  

 If this opportunity sparks your interest, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible! We review applications continuously and will conduct interviews throughout the process.
   

  

 You can submit your application up until 2026-02-15, which is the latest possible date for consideration.
   

  

 When applying, please include your CV. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE
   

  

 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space. Learn more at sscspace.com

title: Application Engineer - Technical Customer Lead
description:
**About Applied Intuition**
 Applied Intuition, Inc. is powering the future of physical AI. Founded in 2017 and now valued at $15 billion, the Silicon Valley company is creating the digital infrastructure needed to bring intelligence to every moving machine on the planet. Applied Intuition services the automotive, defense, trucking, construction, mining and agriculture industries in three core areas: tools and infrastructure, operating systems, and autonomy. Eighteen of the top 20 global automakers, as well as the United States military and its allies, trust the company’s solutions to deliver physical intelligence. Applied Intuition is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California, with offices in Washington, D.C.; San Diego; Ft. Walton Beach, Florida; Ann Arbor, Michigan; London; Stuttgart; Munich; Stockholm; Bangalore; Seoul; and Tokyo. Learn more at applied.co.
   

  

*We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments.*
 Meet our application engineers!
   

  

 Our Application Engineers act as the glue between our customers and our engineering teams. They are responsible for customer success and drive impact with high-priority customer engagements – hear from them on what life is like at Applied Intuition and what makes their roles so exciting!
   

  

**About The Role**
 (We are hiring for all levels of experience.)
   

  

 We are looking for bright engineers interested in leading customer engagements and owning overall account strategy. Our Technical Customer Leads have a unique mix of software expertise, domain knowledge, and execution driven mindset. Using these skills, they work closely with engineering teams to ensure that Applied’s products are providing maximum impact to advance customers’ autonomy initiatives. This is an important role for the company managing customer relationships and ensuring customer success with Applied’s products and expertise.
   

  

 Check out what a typical day would look like as an Application Software Engineer here!
   

  

 At Applied Intuition, you will:
   

  

* Own account strategy for major enterprise customers of Applied
* Manage executive and leadership relationships
* Work closely with customers to understand their development needs and use cases for autonomy to propose effective use of Applied’s products
* Ensure customer needs are supported by broader engineering team through effective prioritization
* Collaborate with our sales teams to gather requirements through detailed technical discussions and workshops
* Explore new product development areas driven by strategic understanding of customer landscape


 We're looking for someone who has:
   

  

* Experience working with automotive OEMs or suppliers
* Prior work in autonomous vehicle or robotics development domains
* 3+ years as either an application engineer or a developer with experience in interacting with end-customers
* Familiarity with best practices in large scale software development
* Strong communication skills and focus on solving customer problems


 Nice to have:
   

  

* Prior background in technical sales or application engineering for simulation products
* Prior work in autonomous vehicle development domains


*Autonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you’ll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.*
*Don’t meet every single requirement? If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.*
*Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.*

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare – Inbyggda system
description:
Som
 **mjukvaruutvecklare** 
 blir du en del av ett engagerat team som utvecklar applikationsmjukvara till produkterna
 **Trackfire RWS** 
 och
 **UTAAS** 
 avancerade system som används både till sjöss och på land, bland annat för försvar mot drönarattacker. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med kunder samt test och utveckling av funktioner direkt i kundens miljö.
 







**Kvalifikationer** 



* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling för inbyggda system
* Mycket goda kunskaper i C och C++
* Erfarenhet av agilt teamarbete
* God kommunikativ förmåga samt flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* God problemlösningsförmåga och ett stort intresse för produktnära utveckling







**Ansvarsområden** 



* Utveckla och vidareutveckla applikationsmjukvara för inbyggda system
* Arbeta nära system-, elektronik- och mekanikingenjörer i tvärfunktionella team
* Testa och verifiera mjukvarufunktioner i labb och i kundens miljö
* Delta i kravanalys, design och implementation av nya funktioner
* Bidra till kontinuerlig förbättring av arbetssätt, kodkvalitet och processer







**Meriterande** 




 Kunskap inom mjukvaruarkitektur, realtidsoperativsystem och Python är meriterande.
 



  





***Annat***




*Vissa av våra kunder kräver att du genomgår och blir godkänd enligt gällande säkerhetsföreskrifter. Vissa tjänster kan också kräva specifikt medborgarskap.* 




  





**Om Astek Sweden** 




 Astek drivs av nyfikenhet och en passion för vad tekniken kan möjliggöra. Den andan genomsyrar allt vi gör vårt engagemang för innovation och produktutveckling, de långsiktiga kundpartnerskap vi bygger och det värde vi skapar i varje uppdrag, varje dag. Vi grundades 1991, är en del av den globala Astek Group och samarbetar idag med ledande industriföretag från våra kontor i Mölndal, Stockholm och Linköping med över 160 kollegor i Sverige. Vi är också certifierade som Great Place to Work® och har åtagit oss att vara 100 % klimatneutrala.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* En inspirerande arbetsplats där teknik och kreativitet möts.
* Möjligheter att samarbeta med ledande aktörer inom industrin i utmanande projekt (mekanisk design, projektledning, elektronik och mjukvara).
* Professionell utveckling och tydliga karriärvägar, med externa utbildningar anpassade efter din utvecklingsplan.
* En stöttande, rolig och inkluderande kultur där dina idéer värdesätts och teamen lyckas tillsammans.
* Generösa förmåner, inklusive ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 SEK.



 Vi uppmuntrar ingenjörer från alla bakgrunder, kön och livssituationer att söka.
 



  





**Vill du bli en del av vårt team?** 




 Vi ser varmt fram emot din ansökan! Rekrytering sker löpande, så vänta inte med att söka. Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor.
 



  





**Rekryteringskontakt** 




 Ydalia Mendoza
 



 E-post: ydalia.mendoza@astek.net
 



 Telefon: +46 072 240 4245

title: Network Development Engineer - Technical operations: AWS Backbone & Interconnection, InfraComms
description:
**Description**
 Amazon Web Services is looking for a highly motivated and technically savvy Network Development Engineer to help operate, develop and scale one of the world’s largest and most complex networks.
   

  

 Come join the InfraComms team within Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a Network Development Engineer (NDE).
   

  

 The InfraComms team within Amazon Web Services (AWS) is responsible for managing the communication, coordination, and operations related to external networks and carriers.
   

  

 The team maintains balanced partnerships with key industry stakeholders, leveraging their technical expertise to enhance the interconnectivity and availability of AWS's global network infrastructure.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of technical leadership and success in driving complex network related issues to resolution, autonomously and/or collaboratively.
   

  

 The successful candidate will demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of networking, networking concepts and theory. They will have experience proactively managing engineering projects, network optimization initiatives and operational network support for a large-scale service provider.
   

  

 As a technical leader, you will manage complex stakeholder operational issues, relationships and develop innovative mechanisms and solutions to enhance the interconnectivity and availability of AWS's global network infrastructure.
   

  

 A love for working with new technologies and pushing the envelope on existing technology is essential! This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon's world-class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies anywhere.
   

  

 AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.
   

  

 You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 As an NDE in the InfraComms team, you will be responsible for:
   

  

 Handling both reactive and proactive operational issues related to AWS's external network services such as PNI, Public Peering, Transit, Embedd Caches, and Backbone.
   

  

 Engaging in advanced triaging for critical services and maintaining ownership of troubleshooting and communication.
   

  

 You will also enhance and develop mechanism to further improve AWS network processes for a better availability and connectivity.
   

  

**About AWS**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The InfraComms team is composed of experts in the internet ecosystem, with comprehensive knowledge of interconnectivity layers.
   

  

 The team operates on a 24x5 schedule across EU/NA/AP regions, ensuring a superior experience for AWS internal and external customers.
   

  

 You will be working alongside a diverse group of Network Development Engineers from the AMER, APAC, and EMEA regions.
   

  

 By joining the InfraComms team, you will play a crucial role in enhancing AWS's network operations and business development strategies, directly contributing to the improvement of internet infrastructure and the customer experience.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience of optical transport (passive and active Layer 1/WDM) operations and networks, auutomation via Bash/Shell scripting and Perl/Python programming.
* Experience with major routing protocols, specifically BGP.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Master’s degree from in Computer Science, Telecommunications or related area.
* Experience in designing and operating large-scale, production networks.
* Experience in routing protocols, network operation and/ or implementation.
* Experience in fiber-optical and WDM network operations.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Data Services Sweden AB
   

  

 Job ID: A3169105

title: Software Engineer
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

 Role Summary
   

  

 As part of Scania’s transition to
 **sustainable transport solutions** 
 , the role focuses on coordinating and ensuring seamless collaboration between our chassis and the bodybuilder at a software level. The position offers an opportunity to work at the interface between Scania’s core vehicle systems and external bodybuilder solutions, ensuring flexibility, safety, and efficiency across diverse customer applications.
   

  

 Job Resposibilities
   

  

  

* Coordinate and oversee the integration of embedded and application-level software for electrified bus systems (e.g., battery, charging, powertrain, and energy management).
* Ensure robust integration of bodybuilder-installed functions such as HVAC, accessibility solutions and warning systems.
* Act as a technical interface for bodybuilders, supporting their integration efforts with Scania’s electrical and software platforms.
* Contribute to continuous improvements in collaboration frameworks, guidelines, and digital integration solutions.


 Who You Are
   

  

  

* Education: B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical –Engineering, or similar.
* Proficiency in C/C++ and/or Python; knowledge of MATLAB/Simulink and AUTOSAR is valuable.
* Familiarity with vehicle communication protocols (CAN, LIN, Ethernet, ISO 15118).
* Solid background in embedded or automotive software development.
* Experience with cross-functional collaboration, ideally with external partners.
* Bus driver license
* Fluent in Swedish and English


 This Is Us
   

  

 We are a passionate team supporting bus bodybuilders worldwide, educating and guiding them to build in line with the Bus Builder’s Manual. Enthusiasm drives us, because nothing spreads faster in the workplace. And yes, we are true bus lovers.
   

  

**Our Leadership Style**
 We thrive in a high-pace environment combined with deep focus tasks. Integrity, teamwork, and fun go hand in hand. We coach our people to achieve what others believe is impossible, always with one clear goal: delivering results towards our stakeholders. We hold the Scania work culture high.
   

  

  

* Be part of the most outstanding and experienced team of Bus Lovers
* A dynamic workplace with varied and challenging tasks.
* A collaborative environment where all team members support each other and contribute to project success.
* Opportunities for continuous learning and development, with training and career growth actively encouraged.
* A wide network of contacts within Scania and with international partners.
* Hands-on product knowledge of buses and their systems.
* The chance to contribute to Scania’s journey towards electrified, connected, and autonomous transport solutions.


 Scania Offers
   

  

 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application, consisting of your CV and kindly ask you not to share a cover letter to ensure an efficient and unbiased recruitment process for all parties.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-02-12. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Patricia Uranga Sarazin, Head of Body Builder Cooperation; patricia.uranga@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Pre-Sales Kvalitet
description:
På Sogeti tror vi att det bästa finns inom oss alla. Oavsett om du är i början av din karriär eller redan på toppen av ditt spel, kommer vi att uppmuntra dig att nå din fulla potential och bli bättre. Genom vår gemensamma passion för teknik, vår entreprenöriella kultur och vårt fokus på kontinuerligt lärande, kommer vi att ge dig allt du behöver för att göra ditt bästa arbete och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

**Pre-Sales Kvalitet**
**Om rollen**
 Vill du forma framtiden för kvalitet inom IT? Är du redo att ta plats - med ödmjukhet, expertis och passion? Då kan du vara den vi söker. Vi söker dig som skapar värde med teknik, älskar kunddialogen, snabbt förstår vad kunden faktiskt behöver och kan forma lösningar som gör skillnad. Du levererar i uppdrag och driver affären, parallellt leder du den tekniska riktningen inom kvalitet. Du får en nyckelroll både operativt och strategiskt - som teknisk pre-sales expert inom området kvalitet.
   

  

*Du verkar på två plan:*
* Kundnära expert - Leder viktiga uppdrag, bygger team och levererar lösningar med hög kvalitet till strategiska kunder.
* Pre-sales för kvalitet - En del av vårt pre-sales team inom Stockholm – Malmö – Helsingborg - Göteborg. Du representerar oss i våra regioner, driver innovation, skapar tydlighet och riktning inom teknik för området kvalitet, bygger relationer och stärker vår affär.


*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att:*
* Vara teknisk rådgivare i försäljning och leverans.
* Definiera och utveckla arkitektur, teknologier och verktyg för området.
* Skapa tydlighet och riktning inom teknik för kvalitet.
* Coacha kollegor och bygga nätverk av experter.
* Driva kundmöten, RFP-svar och marknadsinsatser.


**Din profil**
* Flytande i svenska, både språkligt och kulturellt.
* Erfaren inom test och kvalitet och ser hur det bidrar till högkvalitativa lösningar för olika applikationslandskap.
* Rutinerad i testautomation på flera nivåer och väl insatt i både kommersiella och open source-verktyg.
* Väl förtrogen med hur AI förändrar test, från automation till AI-driven explorativ testning via naturligt språk, där E2E-verktyg som Spur är vardag för dig.
* Trygg i att testa och utvärdera AI-lösningar och kan avgöra inte bara om de fungerar utan även hur väl de presterar, med förståelse för kontinuerliga förbättringsprocesser.
* En naturlig ledare som bygger team och löser problem tillsammans.
* Övertygande i att visa både medarbetare och kunder värdet av kvalitet och att allt börjar där.
* Strategisk, nyfiken, ödmjuk och passionerad.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**
 Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
   

  

 Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

 Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
   

  

 Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.
   

  

**Ansökan**
*Varmt välkommen med din ansökan idag, urval sker löpande! Hoppas vi ses! Vill du veta mer? Kontakta Marta Sundell så berättar hon gärna mer.*
*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
 Om Sogeti
   

  

 Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 19 kontor och 1200 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: Senior Frontendutvecklare
description:
Jobba för originalet.
   

  

 Välkommen till Apoteket, nummer ett sedan 1971. Med visioner för framtiden och kvalitet i varje detalj, skapar vi förutsättningar för ett liv i hälsa. Hos oss utvecklas du i en kultur där din röst alltid blir hörd. Och allt vi får över ger vi tillbaka till samhället. Det är så vi gör skillnad på riktigt.
   

  

 Om Digital Experience & Development
   

  

 På vår Tech-avdelning tror vi på att sätta människan i centrum – både våra kunder och våra medarbetare.
   

  

 I våra tvärfunktionella team ges alla möjlighet att ta initiativ och driva fram nya utvecklingsidéer, från idé till produktion.
   

  

 Inom Digital Experience & Development skapar vi och vidareutvecklar Apotekets digitala kundmöten – som apoteket.se, appen och de flöden som kopplar ihop e-handel och fysisk butik.
   

  

 Här samarbetar produktägare, UX-designers, frontend- och backendutvecklare för att skapa en trygg, enkel och personlig upplevelse.
   

  

 Vårt mål är att göra det lättare för människor att ta hand om sin hälsa – varje dag.
   

  

 Din roll
   

  

 Som Senior Frontendutvecklare hos Apoteket blir du en nyckelperson i vårt arbete med att förbättra och optimera kundupplevelsen på apoteket.se och i vår mobilapp.
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta nära verksamheten och Apotekets kärnaffär, där din kompetens får en direkt påverkan på både kundupplevelse och affärsresultat.
   

  

 Här ser du tydligt effekten av det du utvecklar – de lösningar du bygger bidrar till ökad försäljning, optimerade flöden och en bättre digital kundresa.
   

  

 I rollen kombinerar du tekniskt hantverk med affärsförståelse, och får möjlighet att använda data och iterativa-tester för att driva konkreta, mätbara förbättringar som gör skillnad för både kunder och verksamhet.
   

  

 Du ingår i ett av våra agila team inom Digital Experience & Development som arbetar med områden som checkout, betalflöden, produktsök och produktvisning.
   

  

 Du kommer ingå i ett utvecklingsteam med produktägare, UX-designer, frontend- och backendutvecklare samt testare.
   

  

 Vad du kommer göra hos oss:
   

  

* Bygga och optimera användargränssnitt i React.js / TypeScript och React Native.
* Utveckla och implementera A/B-tester.
* Skriva enhetstester och arbeta strukturerat med Git och Gitflow.
* Samarbeta med UX-designers, produktägare, analytiker och backendutvecklare i ett agilt team.
* Delta i utveckling och drift i Azure och andra molnbaserade miljöer.


**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi söker dig som är självgående, nyfiken och gillar att se tydliga resultat av ditt arbete.
   

  

 Du har flera års erfarenhet som frontendutvecklare och trivs i en miljö där teknik och kundinsikter möts.
   

  

 Du trivs i en miljö där du får bidra till verksamhetens utveckling, driva experiment och optimera för bästa möjliga kundupplevelse.
   

  

* Du har relevant akademisk utbildning.
* Du har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
* Du har flera års erfarenhet av att använda react.js och next.js.
* Du har dokumenterad praktisk erfarenhet av att utveckla React Native-applikationer, med fokus på att rendera webbinnehåll genom webviews och integrera native-funktionalitet.
* Du har erfarenhet av experimentell och iterativ utveckling.
* Du har förståelse för tredjepartsramverk (AB Tasty, Voyado eller liknande).
* Du har erfarenhet av att implementera mätning i kod för analysverktyg som Google Analytics och ContentSquare.


 Meriterande är om du har erfarenhet eller förståelse för backendutveckling.
   

  

  

**Vi erbjuder...**
* Friskvårdsbidrag: 5000 kr per år.
* Personalrabatt: Förmånliga priser på många av våra produkter.
* Flexibla helgdagar: Möjlighet att byta arbetsfria helgdagar mot andra dagar på året.
* Förmånsportal (Benify): Erbjudanden inom bland annat kollektivtrafik, leasingbil, gym och hälsobehandlingar.
* Trygga försäkringar: Förstärkt föräldrapenning, tjänstepension (ITP) och kompletterande försäkringar.


**Om oss**
 Apoteket grundades 1971 och ägs av svenska staten, vilket innebär att vi arbetar både ansvarsfullt och långsiktigt. Vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag handlar om att förbättra människors hälsa, läkemedelsanvändning och bidra till ökad patientsäkerhet. Med omkring 400 apotek och 3000 medarbetare över hela landet har vi nära samarbete med hälso- och sjukvården – alltid med omtanke om både människor och miljö.
   

  

 Vårt mål är tydligt: Ett liv i hälsa, för alla.
   

  

  

**Praktisk information:**
 Nyfiken? Det räcker gott.
   

  

 Hör av dig om rollen fångar ditt intresse! Vi berättar gärna mer om tjänsten och vår verksamhet – så du får en tydligare bild och kan avgöra om det känns helt rätt. Vänta bara inte för länge, urval och intervju sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Skicka ditt CV tillsammans med svar på våra urvalsfrågor. Du behöver inte skriva ett personligt brev – frågorna är utformade för att hjälpa oss förstå mer om dina erfarenheter och kompetenser för matchning mot tjänst.
   

  

 Vi använder tester för objektivt urval som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess. Provanställning tillämpas.
   

  

 Välkommen till Apoteket!

title: SAP Functional Specialist
description:
**Role:**
* Lead and participate in all phases of the SAP project lifecycle including analysis, design, development, testing, deployment, and support.
* Perform system configurations, enhancements, and customizations to meet client needs.
* Define, develop, document and maintain architectural blueprints.
* Drive the Requirements with design /testing and deployment approach.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including developers, architects, business analysts, and project managers to ensure successful project delivery.
* Responsible for the design, build and implementation of complex SAP solutions
* Identify, interpret, validate and document customer requirements including the facilitation of workshops to handle the business requirements


**Essential requirements:**
* 8 to 10 years of SAP functional experience.
* Strong SAP IS-Retail Master Data experience – Article, Hierarchy, Listing, Customer, Supplier, Site – Store & Warehouse and Price
* Merchandising, Assortment & Listing management
* Strong Knowledge and Experience in Master data Solutions including Integrations.
* Experience in SAP SD, SAP MM, SAP CRM, SAP MDG and SAP CAR knowledge is an added advantage.
* Strong experience and knowledge working with integration including SAP CPI, API, KAKFA, AZURE, Event Mesh.
* Profound understanding of SAP Retail business processes
* Should have Strong integration experience with POS and e-Commerce applications.
* Extensive SAP Retail design and implementation experience, having successfully executed multiple SAP Retail full life cycle implementation projects.
* Experience in Atlassian JIRA / Service now / Active Control added advantage.
* Experience in S/4 HANA in any module is an added advantage.
* Experience in Performing detailed analysis of complex business process requirements and provide appropriate Retail system solutions.
* Experience in enhancing the Standard / Custom Interfaces including API, Idoc.
* Deep understanding of Design thinking best practices & Solution architecture framework.
* Good exposure to technical skills with basic debugging
* Excellent documentation/ Presentation skills


**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** 
**when applying.**
**Utilization:** 
 100
 **%**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Period** 
 : 15-02-2026-31-08-2026
   

  

**Last day to apply** 
 : 05-01-2026
   

  

 We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: E-handelsutvecklare till Kreng
description:
**Om rollen**
 Med en mängd olika e-handelsprojekt i bagaget lägger nu våra vänner i nätverket Kreng i ytterligare en växel och behöver bli fler. Som E-handelsutvecklare hos Kreng kommer du få vara med och bidra mycket till bolagets riktning och utveckling.
   

  

 Hos Kreng får du möjlighet att kliva in i en växande organisation och jobba med flera spännande kunder inom olika branscher medans du får utveckla dina kunskaper inom e-handel. Kunderna du får jobba med befinner sig i olika steg i sin e-handelsresa, så du kommer få ta del av flera situationer där din expertis kommer vara avgörande.
   

  

**För att trivs i rollen tror vi att du har**
* Har runt tre års erfarenhet från e-handelsutveckling fokus Magento
* Har goda kunskaper i objektorienterad PHP
* Har viss kunskap i React/Next
* Har kunskaper i HTML/CSS och Javascript
* Gärna testar det senaste inom branschen


**Vi blir extra glada om du har erfarenhet av**
* Shopify eller Woo commerce
* Laravel
* TailwindReact eller Vue / Next eller Nuxt
* API Integrationer via REST eller GraphQL
* Headless CMS


**Vad du erbjuds hos Kreng**
 Vi strävar hela tiden efter att vara en riktigt schysst arbetsplats. Så förutom att vi aldrig jobbar mer än 6 timmar på fredagar, så har vi högt friskvårdsbidrag, generös arbetsutrustning, hybridarbete och gör ofta roliga grejer ihop!
   

  

**Om Kreng**
 Kreng är experter på e-handel. Hos Kreng har man också nära relation till sina systerbolag inom koncernen People People People. PPP växer löpande och bolagen finns representerade i stora delar av Sverige och Europa
   

  

 Kreng är för tillfället 7 glada som gillar att hänga men även jobba hemifrån ibland. På fredagar slutar Kreng alltid klockan 15. Kreng har schysst kontor tillsammans med resten av vår koncern PPP vid Münchenbryggeriet/Bysistorget på söder.
   

  

 Vår koncern PPP har även en egen hosting-lösning där vi jobbar med AWS, Kubernetes och Jenkins. Det är alltid välkommet att lära sig mer om de teknikerna och fortsätta ansvara för din egna tekniska utveckling.
   

  

 Kreng söker dig som gillar att jobba i små team, ha grymt duktiga kollegor och gillar ny teknik.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Tycker du att det låter som en spännande möjlighet? Tveka inte med att skicka in din ansökan idag, urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

**Hiroy – Din partner inom Marknad, Kommunikation och Tech**
 Hos Hiroy förstår vi vad som krävs för att hitta rätt kompetens och skapa framgångsrika samarbeten. Genom vår djupa branschkunskap och dagliga dialog med kunder, kandidater och konsulter har vi en unik helhetsbild av marknaden.
   

  

 Som kandidat eller konsult hos oss blir du en del av vårt starka nätverk, där vi matchar dig med spännande uppdrag och rätt möjligheter för din utveckling. Vi kombinerar aktivt sökande av toppkandidater och konsulter med vårt gedigna nätverk av erfarna experter och passiva kandidater. På så sätt säkerställer vi att du får tillgång till de bästa uppdragen – samtidigt som företag snabbt hittar rätt kompetens.
   

  

 Vi håller oss ständigt uppdaterade kring de senaste trenderna, verktygen och utvecklingarna inom branschen. Genom att dela insikter och expertis hjälper vi dig att ligga steget före och skapa långsiktiga resultat i en konkurrensutsatt marknad.
   

  

 Välkommen till Hiroy – låt oss hitta rätt möjligheter tillsammans!

title: Principal Android Engineer
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Principal Android Engineer** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As a Principal Android Engineer, you will drive the technical vision and strategy for our Android platform, ensuring we build scalable, maintainable, and high-performing solutions.
   

  

 Your time will be split between hands-on development within a cross-functional team and strategic leadership. You’ll collaborate closely with the Android guild and other platform guilds to ensure best practices and long-term goals.
   

  

**This Role Combines Technical Depth And Leadership Impact**
* Contribute to key architectural decisions
* Mentor and support engineers across teams
* Shape how we develop, deploy, and maintain our Android platform to deliver a seamless experience for millions of users


 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Define the technical roadmap and lead the technical strategy for our Android platform
* Align teams across the organization on architecture, frameworks, and tooling
* Write and review code, contributing to both feature development and platform-wide improvements
* Drive best practices, reduce technical debt, and improve maintainability
* Mentor engineers and foster a culture of learning and collaboration
* Work closely with Principal Engineers, Guild Leads, Product Managers, and stakeholders to ensure alignment on priorities


 What we’re looking for
   

  

 We’re looking for an experienced Android Engineer who combines deep technical expertise with strong leadership qualities.
   

  

 You have a passion for guiding teams, shaping strategy, and driving a shared vision. You excel at aligning people toward common goals while staying hands-on with technology.
   

  

 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* Extensive experience developing customer-focused products
* Deep experience building and scaling Android applications
* Strong expertise in Kotlin, Java, or modern Android frameworks
* Strategic insight into Jetpack Compose and the future of Android UI development
* A broad engineering perspective — you’re comfortable stepping beyond a single language or paradigm when it benefits the platform
* Technical leadership experience, setting direction and enacting change
* Ability to align teams and create a shared technical vision beyond the Android platform
* Experience mentoring and coaching engineers
* Solid understanding of CI/CD pipelines, testing strategies, and DevOps practices


**It’s a bonus if you have:**
* Experience working with video streaming platforms
* Experience working with Android TV
* Experience with AI coding tools and agentic frameworks
* A can-do attitude, sense of humor and the ability to work humbly with others.


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with at least three days a week in the office, giving you the best mix of collaboration and focus time.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including series & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


 Hit play today
   

  

 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: AQC söker seniora .NET-utvecklare
description:
Nu söker AQC .NET-utvecklare. Du kommer att delta i spännande konsultuppdrag inom olika branscher där din kompetens gör verklig skillnad, exempelvis genom att bygga robusta backend-lösningar, effektiva integrationer och skalbara molnbaserade applikationer.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:** 




  




* Systemutveckling i .NET / C#
* Universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom IT, datavetenskap eller motsvarande
* Backend-utveckling och API:er (REST, integrationer)
* Frontend-utveckling (t.ex. React, Angular, Blazor eller liknande)
* Databaser och datalagring: SQL Server, Entity Framework, ORM
* Molnplattformar och tjänster: Azure (App Services, Functions, Storage m.m.)
* CI/CD och DevOps: Git, Azure DevOps, pipelines
* Arkitektur och designmönster inom modern systemutveckling
* Talar svenska obehindrat
* Erfarenhet av mikrotjänster, containerteknik (Docker/Kubernetes), säkerhet eller arbete i komplexa och verksamhetskritiska system är meriterande.



  





**Vi tror att du:** 




  




* Har ett genuint intresse för systemutveckling, teknik och problemlösning
* Trivs i rollen som konsult och gillar att samarbeta med både team och kund
* Vill arbeta i en miljö där kvalitet, lärande och utveckling står i fokus
* Behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift



  





**Vi erbjuder:** 




  





 Spännande uppdrag där du får arbeta med moderna .NET-lösningar
 



 En kultur präglad av öppenhet, kompetensdelning och personlig utveckling
 



 Tillgång till AQC-koncernens breda nätverk av specialister och kunder
 



 Trygg anställning och långsiktighet i konsultrollen
 



  





 Hos oss får du vara en del av en tillväxtresa där vi kombinerar systemutveckling, moln och modern teknik för att skapa hållbar och verklig affärsnytta.
 



  





 Låter det som något för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!

title: Senior Business Analysts with Technical flair for Nordic LINK Go Deployments
description:
*Are you passionate about bridging business analysis with hands-on technical configuration? Do you thrive in a dynamic, Nordic environment where your expertise in deployment and configuration makes a tangible impact? Then you might be the new Senior Business Analyst to join our growing Nordic team and help us deliver and optimize KPMG LINK Go deployments for our global client base.*
**Welcome to the Nordic Tax & Legal Technology team**
 Join a Nordic team of 40+ dedicated professionals with expertise across UX design, data engineering, back- and frontend development, cloud architecture, project management, AI, and automation. We work closely with tax specialists across the organization to develop custom software solutions, digital platforms, and data-driven tools that streamline tax processes and enhance decision-making while challenging the future of tax services. We are currently in a Nordic cluster process, merging the local country-specific Nordic teams into one Nordic Tax & Legal Technology team. We combine modern software development with advanced data analytics and AI to push the boundaries of what tax advisory services can be. This is your opportunity to be a part of delivering complex, high-impact systems in a fast-paced, collaborative environment while growing your career.
   

  

**Your Key Responsibilities**
 Your tasks will be varied; however, your primary responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Collaborate closely with Nordic KPMG project teams to execute client deployments of KPMG LINK Go, including hands-on configuration and troubleshooting
* Deploy, maintain and update KPMG LINK Go using JSON configuration files, ensuring settings and variables are optimized and aligned with customer requirements
* Run and support regular update cycles, coordinating and performing UAT in collaboration with KPMG project teams
* Utilize Visual Studio/VS Code and DevOps tools to manage, test, and deploy configurations
* Analyse and understand the downstream effects of configuration changes, proactively identifying and resolving issues
* Collaborate closely with Nordic colleagues and internal stakeholders to ensure seamless deployments and updates


 The position is offered as a hybrid role, giving you the opportunity to work both from home and from our office in Malmö or Stockholm. Travel within the Nordic region is expected.
   

  

 ,
   

  

 You are a technically minded business analyst with an understanding of platform configuration management and deployment. We imagine that you:
   

  

* Have 3–4 years of relevant experience, ideally at the Senior Consultant level, working with technical business analysis, configuration, or deployment
* Possess hands-on experience with json configuration files, Visual Studio/VS Code, and DevOps tools
* Thrive in a collaborative, cross-Nordic environment and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical colleagues
* Are familiar with the professional services industry and can adapt to changing priorities
* Are fluent in a Nordic language and English, both spoken and written
* Have domain knowledge within Mobility (an advantage, but not a requirement)


 We are looking for candidates based in Malmö or Stockholm, with valid work visa permitting employment in Sweden.
   

  

**Do you want to make a difference with us?** 
 If you are interested in becoming a Business Analyst in Nordic Tax & Legal Technology, please send us a motivated application via the link in the job advertisement. Please attach a cover letter, your CV, examination papers, and other relevant documents. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis, so we advise you to send your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Emil Aldershvile (Director Tax Technology) at emil.aldershvile@kpmg.com or +45 5077 0993

title: Staff Product Marketing Manager | Sweden | Remote
description:
Grafana Labs is a remote-first, open-source powerhouse. There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies - including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay - manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).



We’re scaling fast and staying true to what makes us different: an open-source legacy, a global collaborative culture, and a passion for meaningful work. Our team thrives in an innovation-driven environment where transparency, autonomy, and trust fuel everything we do.



You may not meet every requirement, and that’s okay. If this role excites you, we’d love you to raise your hand for what could be a truly career-defining opportunity.


**The Opportunity:**



We are looking for an experienced product marketer to join as a key member of the Grafana Labs Product Marketing team. In this role, you will be responsible for creating Go-To-Market programs that effectively position the value of Grafana Labs and its products to solve the needs of target customers. You will show how our products and solutions — as well as our open source strategy — help prospects and customers achieve their goals.



As a Staff Product Marketing Manager, you will be in charge of the messaging and positioning across key personas and product areas. You’ll work closely with both product management and enablement to help buyers buy (and sellers sell) our value.



Product Marketing lives within the Product org rather than the Marketing org at Grafana Labs, and we are thinking differently about product marketing. Rather than purely executing launches or campaigns, we want PMMs to teach Product Managers and Engineers in our org how to think about growth and demand, and to codify product marketing knowledge in tools and processes that anyone in the organization can use.



Grafana Labs is a fast-paced and growing organization. As such, this role requires both strategic and planning skills as well as hands-on tactical execution (blogs, webinar outlines, video scripts, etc).


**What You'll Be Doing:**


* Actively partner with and teach Product Managers to define product value, messaging, and go-to-market strategy, from competitive positioning to sales enablement collateral.
* Partner with product management, engineering and various go-to-market functions to create materials that help customers evaluate and adopt our products: reference architectures, implementation guides, detailed product information.
* Own and manage the launch of new products/features relevant to target buyers
* Conduct internal and customer research to understand pain points, competition and opportunities
* Teach go-to-market and sales teams how to gain value from our products: clearly define the capabilities of our products and the value they provide, deliver training and enablement, ensure customer facing teams are able to effectively engage with customers, partners, and prospects.
* Own customer lifecycle campaigns (competitive positioning, retention, upsell/cross-sell) to strategically shape marketing programs and drive growth across the entire customer journey.


**What Makes You a Great Fit:**


* 6+ years of relevant experience (product marketing, solutions marketing, product management)
* Experience with marketing and selling to a technical audience
* A passion for open source, cloud native, and infrastructure technologies
* Proven ability to take on complex projects and efficiently drive them from start to finish
* Ability to clearly articulate the value of technical products to customers and sellers alike
* Experience leading product or feature launches autonomously as well as part of a team
* Comfort working with a variety of internal and external stakeholders in complicated processes
* Strong product and technical curiosity that translate to clear packaging, positioning, and messaging
* Demonstrated quantitative analytical skills for analyzing campaign performance, evaluating lifecycle metrics, and making data-driven recommendations.
* Exceptional writing and communication skills
* A high “say-do” ratio in executing and delivering impact


**What you’ll bring to the role**



You’ll bring a passion for quality, pride in the strategic impact of your work, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.


**Compensation & Rewards:**



In Sweden, the Base compensation range for this role is 878,578 SEK - 1,054,294 SEK. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed throughout the interview process. All of our roles include Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), giving every team member ownership in Grafana Labs' success. We believe in shared outcomes—RSUs help us stay aligned and invested as we scale globally.

  

* *Compensation ranges are country specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.*


**Why You’ll Thrive at Grafana Labs:**


* **100% Remote, Global Culture -** As a remote-only company, we bring together talent from around the world, united by a culture of collaboration and shared purpose.
* **Scaling Organization** – Tackle meaningful work in a high-growth, ever-evolving environment.
* **Transparent Communication** – Expect open decision-making and regular company-wide updates.
* **Innovation-Driven** – Autonomy and support to ship great work and try new things.
* **Open Source Roots** – Built on community-driven values that shape how we work.
* **Empowered Teams** – High trust, low ego culture that values outcomes over optics.
* **Career Growth Pathways** – Defined opportunities to grow and develop your career.
* **Approachable Leadership** – Transparent execs who are involved, visible, and human.
* **Passionate People** – Join a team of smart, supportive folks who care deeply about what they do.
* **In-Person onboarding** - We want you to thrive from day 1 with your fellow new ‘Grafanistas’ to learn all about what we do and how we do it.
* **Balance is Key** - We operate a global annual leave policy of 30 days per annum. 3 days of your annual leave entitlement are reserved for Grafana Shutdown Days to allow the team to really disconnect. *\*We will comply with local legislation where applicable.*


**Equal Opportunity Employer:** We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.


*Grafana Labs may utilize AI tools in its recruitment process to assist in matching information provided in CVs to job postings. The recruitment team will continue to review inbound CVs manually to identify alignment with current openings.*



#LI-Remote



*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our* *privacy policy**.*
company_description: Grafana Labs is the company behind Grafana, the leading open source software for visualizing time series data.

title: Partner Management & Sales Support (Cloud & AI Focus)
description:
Job Summary We are seeking a proactive and organized temporary employee to support our Cloud & AI Partner Management, Deal Execution, Business Operations, and Sales Enablement activities. The ideal initiatives.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Cloud & AI Partner Management
  
Coordinate scheduling and logistics for meetings and activities with Cloud & AI technology partners.
  
  

Organize and support meetings with key Cloud & AI partner stakeholders.
  
  

Plan, coordinate, and execute internal events involving Cloud & AI partners and customers.
  
Cloud & AI Deal Execution
  
Provide administrative support for Cloud & AI deal-related tasks.
  
  

Assist with Cloud & AI deal registration processes to ensure timely and accurate submission.
  
Business Operations
  
Track and report on the top 10 Cloud & AI business opportunities, maintaining up-to-date records.
  
  

Monitor and maintain oversight of Cloud & AI sales figures and related data.
  
  

Coordinate and execute administrative work for events and activities related to Cloud & AI.
  
Sales Enablement
  
Drive event attendance and participation, particularly for Cloud & AI-focused events and initiatives.
  
  

Ensure effective follow-up after events to maximize Cloud & AI sales enablement outcomes.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Experience in administrative support, project coordination, or a similar role.
  
  

Familiarity with Cloud & AI solutions, technologies, and partner ecosystems is an advantage.
  
  

Excellent organizational and communication skills.
  
  

Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.
  
  

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint) or equivalent tools.
  
  

Experience with event planning and/or sales support is a plus.
  
  

Example Activities
  
Scheduling and preparing agendas for monthly Cloud & AI tech partner meetings.
  
  

Supporting submission and tracking of Cloud & AI deal registrations.
  
  

Maintaining a dashboard of top Cloud & AI business opportunities and sales metrics.
  
  

Sending out invitations, tracking RSVPs, and managing attendee follow-up communications for Cloud & AI events.
  
  

Notes & Considerations
  
This is a temporary "Red Badge" assignment; duration and work hours may vary.
  
  

The role involves interaction with internal teams, external partners, and customers, particularly in the Cloud & AI space.
  
  

Attention to detail and confidentiality are essential.

title: Kommunikatör till Sjukhusen i väster
description:
**Kommunikatör till Sjukhusen i väster**
========================================

**Förvaltning:** Sjukhusen i väster
**Yrke:** Informatör/Kommunikatör
**Ort:** Kungälv
**Anställningsform:** Tidsbegränsad anställning
**Publicerad:** 29 januari 2026
**Sista ansökningsdag:** 15 februari 2026
**Sjukhusen i väster, Kommunikationsenhet**
-------------------------------------------

Sjukhusen i väster är en förvaltning inom Västra Götalandsregionen och består av fyra sjukhus –  

Alingsås lasarett, Angereds närsjukhus, Högsbo närsjukhus och Kungälvs sjukhus. Cirka 3000 medarbetare arbetar varje dag hos oss för att ge en god och säker specialistsjukvård av högsta kvalitet.


**Om verksamheten**  

Kommunikationsenheten består av fyra kommunikatörer, leds av en kommunikationschef och tillsammans ger vi strategiskt och operativt stöd till ledning och verksamheter utifrån olika spetskompetenser.


Kommunikationsenhetens ansvar är bland annat: intern, lednings- och extern kommunikation, intern och extern webb, sociala medier, press- och mediarelationer, kriskommunikation, varumärkesarbete, film och foto, grafisk produktion samt projektkommunikation. Västra Götalandsregionen och Sjukhusen i väster har stort fokus på omställningen av hälso- och sjukvården där digitalisering och utvecklade arbetssätt är viktiga nycklar.

**Om tjänsten**  

Tjänsten som kommunikatör hos oss har fokus på film och grafisk produktion. I rollen som kommunikatör kommer du stärka kommunikationsteamet och vara behjälplig med varierade uppgifter inom kommunikationsområdet. Du kommer att arbeta både operativt och strategiskt. Du kommer att ha din placering på Kungälvs sjukhus men i tjänsten ingår att arbeta från våra olika sjukhus vid behov.

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer att vara:**

* film och grafisk produktion
* arbeta med Sjukhusen i västers sociala mediekanaler tillsammans med övriga i teamet
* innehållsproduktion till sjukhusens digitala skärmar
* redaktionellt textinnehåll till intranät och webbplatser
* analysera kommunikationsbehov, identifiera målgrupper, budskap, aktiviteter och kanaler
* praktiskt arbeta med kommunikation i olika projekt och publicera i olika kanaler
* bidra till kontinuerlig utveckling av kommunikationsarbetet och arbetsprocesser för att stärka enhetens samlade kommunikativa kompetens.

**Kvalifikationer**  

Vi söker dig som har:

* högskole- eller universitetsexamen med inriktning medie- och kommunikationsvetenskap eller utbildning som bedöms likvärdig
* mycket goda kunskaper i svenska i såväl tal som skrift, samt mycket god språkkänsla
* erfarenhet av att filma och leverera slutprodukt
* erfarenhet av grafisk produktion och textproduktion
* erfarenhet av att arbeta i CMS (vi använder Optimizely)
* flerårig erfarenhet av arbete i Adobe Creative Cloud
* kunskaper om digital tillgänglighetsanpassning.


Vi söker en engagerad och kunnig person som arbetar bra både i grupp och självständigt. Du arbetar bra med andra människor och relaterar till dem på ett lyhört och smidigt sätt. Du lyssnar, kommunicerar och löser eventuella hinder på ett konstruktivt sätt. Du uppskattar att arbeta i ett öppet klimat, nära dina kollegor, där vi hjälps åt, backar upp varandra och har kul på jobbet. Du är mål- och resultatinriktad och samtidigt prestigelös. Du har gott omdöme och gör avvägningar och prioriteringar för verksamhetens bästa. Du väger samman komplex information och olika typer av hänsynstaganden och visar gott omdöme vid uttalanden, agerande och beslut.


För att vara framgångsrik i rollen som kommunikatör hos oss behöver du arbeta planerat och långsiktigt, samtidigt som du snabbt behöver kunna byta fokus för att jobba med aktuella frågor här och nu. Du ska ha förmåga att kunna göra egna avvägningar och prioriteringar då arbetet ställer höga krav på din förmåga att hantera ett högt tempo, och kunna fatta balanserade beslut även under pressade förhållanden. Du bör också ha lätt för att anpassa dig till ändrade omständigheter samt se möjligheterna i olika förändringar.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.


Är det dig vi söker? Vi ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan. Om du blir utvald till intervju vill vi se exempel på arbetsprover.  

  

Intervjuer kommer att genomföras den 24 och 25 februari.  

  

**Anställningsform**  

Vikariat 1 år med möjlighet till förlängning.

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**


**Om Västra Götalandsregionen**  

Västra Götalandsregionen finns till för människorna i Västra Götaland. Vi ser till att det finns god hälso- och sjukvård för alla. Vi arbetar för en hållbar utveckling och tillväxt, bra miljö, förbättrad folkhälsa, ett rikt kulturliv och goda kommunikationer i hela Västra Götaland.  

Västra Götalandsregionen arbetar aktivt för att digitalisera fler arbetssätt. För att vara en del av den digitala omvandlingen har du med dig grundläggande färdigheter och kan använda digitala verktyg och tjänster. Du kan söka information, kommunicera, interagera digitalt, är riskmedveten och har motivation att delta i utvecklingen för att lära nytt.  

Västra Götalandsregionen krigsplacerar alla tillsvidareanställda medarbetare.



Vill du veta mer om Västra Götalandsregionen kan du besöka vår introduktion till nya medarbetare på länken www.vgregion,se/introduktion. Du kan även läsa mer i presentation om Lön, ersättning och förmåner – det här får du som medarbetare i VGR.  

  

  



**Ansökan**  

Västra Götalandsregionen ser helst att du registrerar din ansökan via rekryteringssystemet. Om du som sökande har frågor om den utannonserade tjänsten eller av särskilda och speciella skäl inte kan registrera dina uppgifter i ett offentligt system - kontakta kontaktperson för respektive annons.


**Till bemannings-, förmedlings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare:**  

Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings-, förmedlings- och rekryteringsföretag samt andra externa aktörer och försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Västra Götalandsregionen har upphandlade avtal.


**Mer om tjänsten**
