title: Accessibility Engineer
description:
*The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a* *Accessibility Engineer* *to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.*

***Period:*** *ASAP to April 2026 (full-time), with a possibility of extension.*

#### **About the role**


Are you passionate about accessibility and building inclusive experiences? Excellent! We are looking for an experienced Accessibility Engineer contractor to join our client's in-house accessibility team.  

  

Solving for inclusion requires empathy with users, building influential relationships, proposing bold ideas, and introducing new processes that integrate accessibility thinking into our product development. Your work will have a high impact as you partner with other engineers, designers, and user researchers to build the tools, processes, and frameworks needed to ensure our client's experiences are accessible and inclusive for all their millions of users.

#### **What you'll do**

* Work day-to-day with an agile team of engineers, designers, user researchers, and product managers to build and maintain our central approach to accessibility.
* Collaborate with other engineering teams on code reviews, evolving our shared processes and tooling to support many teams working on the client's exciting range of products.
* Propose and lead initiatives that help achieve their goal of scaling accessibility and ultimately making the experience more inclusive.
* Educate, inspire, and influence fellow colleagues by sharing your knowledge and experience of accessibility through specific guidelines and accessibility training based on findings from user research.
* Drive the adoption of accessibility across the company by partnering and occasionally embedding with their product teams as they update existing and build exciting new features.
* Find innovative approaches, improve the developer experience, and remove any friction teams may have when building accessible experiences.

#### **Who you are**

* A fullstack engineer with experience making web or mobile apps, tools or features accessible.
* You have good knowledge and understanding of WCAG criteria and accessibility best practices.
* You are aware of the needs and challenges people with disabilities face when using software.
* You understand and are able to articulate the difference between web accessibility and mobile accessibility.
* You are comfortable using assistive technologies such as screen readers and accessibility features across various platforms (incl. VoiceOver, Talkback, Browser extensions, JAWS, and NVDA).
* You have experience auditing and testing digital products for accessibility.
* You enjoy mentoring and supporting peers and engineering teams, fostering the best engineering and accessibility practices.
* You are eager to learn new technologies (the team will support you with training & mentoring).

#### **We are Market Partner**

*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like. We apply ongoing selection and may fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate.*

title: AI Ops Engineer - Finance
description:
**TL;DR** — You'll make sure no one at Lovable spends time on anything AI can do. We're defining how AI-native companies operate internally, across Product, GTM, and G&A. You'll own the systems that let a 200-person team move like a 2,000-person company: workflow automations, internal AI tools, data enrichment pipelines. You'll use Lovable itself to build much of this. This role is part of Project Automate Lovable, working closely with our AI Operations & Automation function and FBOS team.

### **Why Lovable?**


Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.


We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity, and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.

### **What we’re looking for**

* **Shipped production automations at a company:** You've built workflow systems at scale that ran without you. Actual business-critical automations used by teams.
* **Engineering brain, modern toolkit:** You understand how systems actually work (APIs, databases, architecture) and can review code confidently. You move fast by choosing the right tool for the job: AI agents (Cursor, Claude Code etc) when they're faster, no-code (n8n, Lovable itself, Clay, etc.) when it fits, raw code when it's needed. Python, TypeScript, SQL etc.
* **AI tool obsessed:** You're always testing the latest models, apps, and workflows before anyone else. You've deployed internal AI tools (Claude/ChatGPT with custom contexts, AI agents, MCPs, etc.) at a company and you're constantly experimenting with new ones.
* **Can't unsee inefficiency:** You see the whole company as one machine. Once you spot a broken process, you can't leave it alone.
* **High agency:** You don't wait for permission. You find the bottleneck, build the fix, and ship it.
* **Bonus:** Ex-founder, worked at AI-native startup, or built automations across multiple business functions.

### **What you’ll do**


Own internal AI systems that make Lovable run faster than it should.

* **Define how AI-native companies operate:** Help build the playbook. What we learn here scales to every company using Lovable.
* **Build internal tools and workflows:** Using Lovable, AI agents, no-code, raw code—whatever gets the job done fastest. Lovable on Lovable first, always.
* **Deploy AI agent armies:** Claude/ChatGPT with MCPs configured so every teammate has AI working for them, not the other way around.
* **Squeeze value from our stack:** Make the AI features in Slack, Linear, Notion, Ashby, etc. actually deliver.
* **Level up the team:** Turn everyone at Lovable into AI power users. Document what works. Scale it.
* **Own it end-to-end:** You build it, you maintain it, you improve it.

### **How we hire**

* Fill in a short form, then send a quick Loom. Intro yourself and the coolest thing you've built.
* Complete a take-home: Build something that solves a real problem and shows how you think. Use Lovable or whatever gets the job done.
* Technical interview: Walk us through how you think about systems and automation.
* Cross-functional interviews: Meet your customers, the various cross-functional teammates whose work you will empower.

### **About your application**


Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language, so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.


We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested, please apply through our careers portal.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer to Husqvarna Construction in Jonsered
description:
Last date to apply:
28 February 2026
Our Design Engineering team are looking for a Mechanical Design Engineer to Husqvarna Construction in Jonsered.
Would you like to be part of the process from the first sketch to start of production? If so, this might be the dream position for you! A varied work where you clearly can see your impact on the result.
What do we do
The Design Engineering team works with new development and product improvement of Husqvarna's light equipment products, like power cutters, drill motors etc.
Our products are developed at the forefront of technology, driven by growing environmental awareness and the need for more sustainable solutions. They are primarily handheld, engineered with a high power‑to‑weight ratio, and consistently designed with a strong focus on ergonomics to ensure an optimal user experience.
With us, you’ll be part of a positive, supportive organization where collaboration truly matters. Our work is carried out in project‑based setups, with small, cross‑functional teams working closely alongside project management, electronics and software, testing, and production.
Product development here is diverse and hands‑on—spanning everything from the first sketch to the start of production, always with the customer at the center. As a newcomer, you’ll quickly build a solid understanding of our products and their architecture. Thanks to the team’s strong expertise and inclusive mindset, there is always someone nearby to guide you and answer questions.
At Husqvarna Construction we strive to have a work environment that is inclusive and diverse, where we believe that our differences are our strengths. Our winning culture is important to us, which is why we go by the beliefs: We are Bold, We are Dedicated and We Care.
Who are you
We are looking for you with a solid mechanical interest who wants to work with problem solving in a CAD environment. Primarily you will work with handheld products, designing parts in magnesium, aluminum and plastic.
We see that you have a degree in engineering at university level or similar.
You speak and write English freely.
Location: This position is based in Jonsered.
Your application
Are you the one we are looking for? Please don’t hesitate to apply as soon as possible, we apply ongoing selection. We do not accept applications via e-mail due to GDPR regulations.
If you have questions regarding the position please contact Daniel Ericson, R&D Manager Design Engineering at daniel.ericson@husqvarnagroup.com
For questions regarding the recruitment process please contact Recruiter – Katarina Engberg at katarina.engberg@husqvarnagroup.com*Husqvarna Construction Division* *is a leading global manufacturer of innovative equipment and diamond tools within the light construction industry. Our portfolio includes machines, solutions, services and diamond tools made for professionals who work with hard materials like concrete and stone to shape urban environments of tomorrow. We sell and service our products worldwide in more than 100 countries, net sales in 2024: SEK 7,8 billion and approximately 2,500 employees.*

title: Senior Software Development Engineer
description:
Senior Software Development Engineer (Nordic Baltic)
  
  

We’re looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our Software Development team in the Nordic Baltic zone.
  
  

In this role, you’ll build and evolve the web applications that power Schneider Electric’s engineering and digital solutions. You’ll work closely with product managers, designers, and cross-functional engineering teams to create seamless, intuitive, and performant user experiences across our platforms.
  
  

Your expertise in Razor, React, JavaScript, and C# will play a key role in shaping applications that support our customers and internal teams across the region.
  
  

Why this role matters
  
  

Software is at the heart of Schneider Electric’s digital transformation. The solutions you create will help drive efficiency, reliability, and innovation across buildings, infrastructure, industry, and energy management.
  
  

Your work will ensure our applications remain modern, scalable, and ready to support the evolving needs of our customers and engineering teams.
  
  

What drives us at Schneider Electric
  
  

IMPACT isn’t just a buzzword here, it’s embedded in our culture. Schneider Electric makes homes, buildings, data centers, and entire industries more efficient and sustainable. By joining us, you’ll help accelerate the energy transition and tackle the climate crisis head-on.
  
  

We’re proud to be ranked among the world’s most sustainable companies. Beyond that, we help millions in underserved communities gain access to energy and education, making the world fairer and greener. You’ll work alongside colleagues from diverse backgrounds, united by a shared vision of a better future.
  
  

What you’ll do
  
* Develop and maintain web applications using Razor, JavaScript, React, and C#.
* Collaborate with cross‑functional teams to translate requirements into high-quality technical solutions.
* Implement responsive, intuitive UI designs for a seamless user experience across devices.
* Optimize performance and address bottlenecks to ensure smooth application operation.
* Write clean, maintainable, and scalable code following industry best practices.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues to maintain stability and reliability.
* Stay current with industry trends and contribute ideas to keep our applications modern and competitive.


What you need to succeed
  
* 3+ years of experience as a Full Stack Developer.
* Strong skills in Razor, React, JavaScript, and C#.
* Solid understanding of HTML, CSS, and modern front‑end frameworks.
* Experience with .NET Core, RESTful APIs, and SQL databases. ...

title: Project Engineer
description:
Job Description

**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?**

**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.**


As a Project Engineer at ourUpplands VäsbyPlant (home ofMarabou), you will be instrumental in planning, developing, and executing capital projects. You willdrivetechnical developments, assess the feasibility of engineering activities within the supply chain, and manage capitalinvestmentprojects to drive growth, world-class manufacturing, and productivity while upholding the highest standards of quality, safety, and environmental responsibility.You will work in alignment with Mondelēz's business processes, ensuringcompany standards and consistently met.

**How You Will Contribute**


In this role, you will lead a portion of the Project Engineering agenda withinSwedenand oversee specific areas of theSite strategy, aligning with site compliance, productivity, and development objectives. You will develop and implement multiple projectsacross the site,


Your responsibilities will include:

* Collaborate with key stakeholders to define and deliver technical and capital plans during the development phases of investment projects, ensuring budgetand timelinecontroland appropriate technical solutions.
* Project scope could cover many areas but especiallymass making,moulding & forming processes, packaging, palletising and site infrastructure &utilitiesplanning.
* Concurrently manageaportfolio of projects (upwards of $1-2MM/annum)with localteamsduring the complete project cycle.You will lead project teams consisting ofMaintenance,HSE, Quality,Facilities, Operations, and Logistics.
* Design fit-for-purpose technical solutions, develop and implement of state-of-the-art processes and equipment strategies to optimize resources, harmonize assets, and roll out best practices. Create detailedequipment and processstudies and specifications,conduct DOEs, drive commissioning and qualificationtesting, documenting all through technical reports.Share and learn from best practices aroundMondelēz'sglobal network.
* Work closely with Regional RDQ, Supply Chain and Business Development teams to deliver on Regional Productivity and Innovation programs.
* Collaborateon the development and implementation of state-of-the-art processes and equipment strategies, together with local process engineering and RDQ.
* Create and controlbudget in accordance with contractual obligations, including accurate forecasting of cash flow, finding the best value for cost for chosen schemes.
* Management of external equipment suppliers and construction groups, running the RFI/RFP/RFQ cycle, and conducting formalized bids with Procurement.Once kicked off, management of supplier(s) technicaldeliverables, and project delivery safely, on time, in cost, and in quality.
* Manage detailedtime plansin standard project management software. Clearly definingwork packages, tasks,durations,connectingdependencies, allocating resources, and setting realistic deadlines, while accounting for potential risks.
* Utilize technical expertise to support in the site Master Planningcycle(equipment and infrastructure planning on a 5 year horizon).
* Ensurethe implementation of engineering safety, quality, hygiene and environmental standardsaccording toMondelēzGlobal Specifications and regionalrequirements.
* Continuous improvement of existing practices, methods and technology. Proactively seekingopportunities to improve factoryefficiency, safety and quality, driving several capital projects, to help deliver thesite agenda.
* A thorough and continue professional development in understanding of all aspects of confectionery making, wrapping, packing and services, particularly within the Chocolate category is developed, and external supplier developments are kept up to date with.
* You will also support the broader site andregionalteams as a key technical expert, leading significant projects.Some travel toany of theEuropeanConfectioneryplants can be expected.
**What You Will Bring**


A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career, with experience and knowledge in:

title: Application Engineer - Technical Customer Lead
description:
**About Applied Intuition**
---------------------------


Applied Intuition, Inc. is powering the future of physical AI. Founded in 2017 and now valued at $15 billion, the Silicon Valley company is creating the digital infrastructure needed to bring intelligence to every moving machine on the planet. Applied Intuition services the automotive, defense, trucking, construction, mining and agriculture industries in three core areas: tools and infrastructure, operating systems, and autonomy. Eighteen of the top 20 global automakers, as well as the United States military and its allies, trust the company's solutions to deliver physical intelligence. Applied Intuition is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California, with offices in Washington, D.C.; San Diego; Ft. Walton Beach, Florida; Ann Arbor, Michigan; London; Stuttgart; Munich; Stockholm; Bangalore; Seoul; and Tokyo. Learn more at applied.co.
*We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments.*

**Meet our application engineers!**
-----------------------------------


Our Application Engineers act as the glue between our customers and our engineering teams. They are responsible for customer success and drive impact with high-priority customer engagements – hear from them on what life is like at Applied Intuition and what makes their roles so exciting!

**About the role**
------------------


(We are hiring for all levels of experience.)

We are looking for bright engineers interested in leading customer engagements and owning overall account strategy. Our Technical Customer Leads have a unique mix of software expertise, domain knowledge, and execution driven mindset. Using these skills, they work closely with engineering teams to ensure that Applied's products are providing maximum impact to advance customers' autonomy initiatives. This is an important role for the company managing customer relationships and ensuring customer success with Applied's products and expertise.

Check out what a typical day would look like as an Application Software Engineer here!
**At Applied Intuition, you will:**
-----------------------------------


* Own account strategy for major enterprise customers of Applied
* Manage executive and leadership relationships
* Work closely with customers to understand their development needs and use cases for autonomy to propose effective use of Applied's products
* Ensure customer needs are supported by broader engineering team through effective prioritization
* Collaborate with our sales teams to gather requirements through detailed technical discussions and workshops
* Explore new product development areas driven by strategic understanding of customer landscape

**We're looking for someone who has:**
--------------------------------------


* Experience working with automotive OEMs or suppliers
* Prior work in autonomous vehicle or robotics development domains
* 3+ years as either an application engineer or a developer with experience in interacting with end-customers
* Familiarity with best practices in large scale software development
* Strong communication skills and focus on solving customer problems

**Nice to have:**
-----------------


* Prior background in technical sales or application engineering for simulation products
* Prior work in autonomous vehicle development domains

  


*Autonomy is one of the leading technological advances of this century that will come to impact our lives. The work you'll do at Applied will meaningfully accelerate the efforts of the top autonomy teams in the world. At Applied, you will have a unique perspective on the development of cutting edge technology while working with major players across the industry and the globe.*

*Don't meet every single requirement? If you're excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.*


*Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.*

title: Product Owner inom Embedded Linux hos Ictech
description:
Vill du arbeta nära tekniken men med ett större ansvar för helhet, prioriteringar och teamets arbete?
  
Hos Ictech i Göteborg söker vi nu en erfaren ingenjör med stark teknisk bakgrund inom Embedded Linux som är redo att gå in i en roll som Product Owner!
  
Det här är en roll för dig som är trygg i kod, men som är redo att ta ett kliv mot en mer ansvarsfull och övergripande roll.
  
Om rollen
  
I rollen går du in som Product Owner för ett Ictech-team mot en av våra kunder. Embedded Linux-baserad mjukvaruplattform inom automotive. Du arbetar nära utvecklingsteamet och tar ansvar för prioriteringar, struktur och riktning, samtidigt som du har tillräcklig teknisk tyngd för att ta välgrundade beslut.
  
Du förväntas inte ha arbetat som Product Owner tidigare, men du behöver vara nyfiken och redo för en roll med tydligt ansvar för gruppen, där ditt fokus ligger på att ha en överblick över systemet, kvalitet och framdrift snarare än enbart kod.
  
Kodning förekommer (främst i C++), men i mindre omfattning över tid, i takt med att ditt ansvar växer.
  
  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**  

Driva arbetet kring en Linux-baserad automotive software-platform
  
  

Arbeta nära utvecklingsteamet kring prioriteringar och tekniska vägval
  
  

Säkerställa kvalitet, struktur och ha ett förutseende perspektiv om vad som kommer längre fram
  
  

Bidra tekniskt där det behövs, främst i C++ och Python
  
  

Vara en samlande kraft i teamet, både tekniskt och organisatoriskt
  
  

Plattformen används i en miljö där stabilitet, prestanda och pålitlighet är avgörande, system som ska fungera i verkligheten, inte bara i teorin.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Du har gedigen erfarenhet av Embedded Linux och känner dig trygg i miljöer där systemförståelse, stabilitet och långsiktighet är avgörande. Du är redo för en roll med större ansvarstagande och ett tydligt ägarskap för gruppen. Du är kommunikativ och trivs i dialogen mellan teknik och människor.
  
  

Är flytande i programmeringsspråk som C++ och Python
  
  

Erfarenhet och vana av att jobba i Jira
  
  

Erfarenhet av C, GoogleTest, JSON, Cmake, Git och Jenkins är meriterande
  
  

Svenska är meriterande, men inget krav.
  
  

Hos oss på Ictech
  
Vi är ett teknik- och konsultbolag på Lindholmen i Göteborg. Här samlas några av branschens mest erfarna utvecklare, i snitt runt 17 års erfarenhet, som alla delar samma driv: att bygga riktigt bra teknik, tillsammans med människor som brinner lika mycket för det som de själva gör.
  
Vi tror på frihet under ansvar, på att människor växer när de får påverka, och på att nördighet är något att vara stolt över. Hos oss kan du själv styra vilka uppdrag du tar, hur du vill utvecklas och hur din lönemodell ska se ut.
  
Kulturen då? Tänk dig en plats där kaffet alltid är nybryggt, koden alltid går att förbättra, och där lunchsamtalen kan börja med en diskussion om designmönster och sluta med en het debatt om dinosauriernas evolution. Vi gillar teknik, absolut, men vi gillar ännu mer att skratta, lära av varandra och utforska allt det som ligger mellan raderna i både livet och koden.
  
Det är nyfikenheten, gemenskapen och respekten för kompetens som håller ihop oss och som gör att vi trivs riktigt bra ihop.

title: Product Imaging Engineer, Lund
description:
Job Title
Product Imaging Engineer, Lund
Job Description*Do you want to work in a team where creativity and new ideas are truly valued? This is your opportunity to become a Product Imaging Engineer and help lay the groundwork for developing the world’s best traffic surveillance cameras.*
Your future team – Fixed Cameras Imaging
You will join a small, dedicated team of imaging engineers focused on adapting and fine-tuning Axis’ latest image platform algorithms for new products. Our work is largely project-based and involves close collaboration with many different disciplines, including firmware, mechanics, electronics, and production technology. Together, we bring future Axis cameras to life.
Your role
We are looking to strengthen our ability to adapt the Axis imaging platform to specific market use cases. With traffic surveillance being a key growth area for Axis, your main responsibility will be to provide our imaging engineers with the best possible platform for future traffic cameras.
To succeed in this role, you will work closely with other imaging engineers within Fixed Cameras Imaging and our Core Tech Imaging teams. Together, you will identify which parts of the imaging platform should be adapted for traffic use cases and drive the implementation of these changes. You will also contribute directly to product development by taking responsibility for image tuning and image-related issues in future camera projects when needed.
You will be part of a small, focused team with a shared goal: creating the best possible traffic surveillance cameras.
Who are you?
We are looking for someone who enjoys developing innovative products and wants to work with image technology in a cross-functional environment. You have a few years of relevant work experience, a genuine interest and a master’s degree, in areas such as physics, mathematics, computer science, imaging, or electronics.
It is considered a merit if you have professional experience in one or more of the following areas:* Image algorithms
* Software development
* C++/C or Python in a Linux environment
* Data analysis, signal processing, and image enhancement techniques
* Optical assemblies and CMOS sensors


Practical experimental work through technical hobbies, academic projects, or professional experience is also considered a plus.
Just as important as your technical skills, you are a friendly and collaborative team player who enjoys helping others and contributing to a positive team atmosphere. You appreciate working in a group where people support each other, share knowledge, and solve problems together on a daily basis.
What Axis has to offer
We are a world leader in network video, where cutting-edge technology meets global impact. Here, you’ll contribute to meaningful projects that shape the future of security and surveillance — developing solutions used worldwide.
As a fast-growing company, we offer exciting career opportunities. You’ll grow professionally through continuous learning, supported by a collaborative team that values creativity, innovation, and work-life balance.*Our Lund HQ Campus, including the impressive Grenden building, offers a dynamic environment with spaces crafted to encourage collaboration, whether through informal “**fika**” chats, formal meetings,* *or after-hours activities.* *Check it out:* *Axis HQ*
Your well-being matters to us. We offer a range of benefits, including a company bonus, Friday cake, wellness allowance, health insurance — and even your own Axis bicycle.
To learn more about Axis, our innovative products, solutions, and vibrant company culture, explore:  

Life at Axis blog  

Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
We go through applications continuously so don’t wait – send in your application today!
In case of questions, please reach out to recruiting manager Martin Nyman, Martin.Nyman@axis.com.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2026-02-26*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Chief Engineer, Strategic R&D
description:
The **Chief Engineer, Strategic R&D**, is Milrem’s principal technical leader for the Strategic R&D portfolio. The role sets the technical vision for EU/EDA/EDF initiatives and maintains the long-term R&D technology roadmap aligned with product and business priorities.


Working across engineering, business, and leadership, the Chief Engineer governs the technical approach of Strategic R&D programs, drives reuse of R&D results into products, and ensures sound technical decisions, risk management, and compliance. The role enables business development through technical shaping of funded programs and partnerships.

 **What you´ll be doing:**

* Set and communicate the Strategic R&D technical vision and maintain the technology roadmap, including capability gaps and maturation paths.
* Lead technical shaping and oversight of EU/EDA/EDF projects, ensuring quality, alignment, and reuse potential.
* Define and govern technical frameworks for the transition of R&D outcomes into product development, including integration readiness and key standards compliance.
* Drive technical decision-making and manage technical risks, balancing feasibility, performance, cost, schedule, and security.
* Consolidate and govern R&D knowledge from internal and EU projects, enabling reuse through architectures, guidelines, and lessons learned.
* Act as a senior technical counterpart in partner and stakeholder engagements, supporting capture and proposals with credible technical plans.
* Improve Strategic R&D ways of working, and mentor technical leaders involved in the portfolio.

**What we’re looking for:**

* 10+ years in R&D and engineering roles in defence or relevant industries, with systems engineering and integration exposure.
* Track record leading cross-domain technical initiatives and influencing architecture and engineering practices.
* Experience with externally funded programs (EU/EDA/EDF or similar) and technical stakeholder coordination.
* Experience working with industrial partners in a technical leadership capacity.
* Systems engineering and integration expertise, including hardware-software interoperability and trade-off management.
* Ability to establish technical governance and drive consistent engineering practices.
* Strong grasp of reliability, performance, security, and compliance trade-offs in complex systems.
* Clear communication and influence across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Ph.D. in a relevant engineering discipline is strongly recommended, or equivalent depth of expertise.

**What we offer:**

* **A strategic technical leadership role with real influence**


You will shape Milrem Robotics’ long-term R&D technology roadmap and influence future products beyond individual projects, operating at the enterprise level.

* **Autonomy and trust**


This role comes with the authority to define technical direction, set standards, and represent Milrem technically with partners, customers, and EU programs.

* **Impact on future defence systems**


You will work on advanced, complex and autonomous systems, ensuring research outcomes transition into real, operational products.

* **Close collaboration with leadership**


You will work directly with the CPO, engineering and product leadership, acting as a trusted technical advisor in key decisions.


Join us at the true cutting edge of defence sector technology.


Please send your application by **23.02.2026** at the latest. We review applications continuously and may contact qualified candidates for interviews before the official deadline.  

  

Don’t forget to read more about working at Milrem: careers.milrem.com

title: Embedded Software System Engineer - Rust
description:
At Volvo Cars, we believe that being curious and truly committed to understanding people is the key to future success. We are people who care about other people, working together to create new technologies and innovations for safe, sustainable, and convenient mobility. Want to join us?

**This is what your new colleagues do**


We are building a high-performance computer-in-the-car architecture. We are leaders in the paradigm shift that is happening in the car industry. A key for enabling innovation within areas such as Autonomous Drive, Advanced Connectivity, and Machine Learning. Our mission is to create a vehicle computer platform using the latest technologies and the latest chip technology in combination with more traditional car signaling technologies. We are dedicated to delivering platform functions to simplify application development to create a safe, reliable, and secure platform solution within Volvo Cars for increased innovation and speed.


Within the Central Execution Environment, team Trust is responsible for the Low Power Unit (LPA) team. Completely in-house developed in Rust. New projects are being prepared, and here we are looking for a senior software system engineer. The location is Gothenburg or Lund.

**What you will do**


As a software system engineer for this position, you will:

* Develop software using Rust programming language
* Participate in the system architecture design
* Break down requirements
* Create test cases
* Handle build system and support tools
* Handle our CI/CD infrastructure
* Handle and improve the release process
* Advanced engineering R&D investigations
* Supporting the different work groups & and stakeholders
* Fault-finding
* Work in a highly empowered agile team that is responsible for creating


everything from requirements and software architecture to implementation


and test

**Who are you?**


We want to work with those of you who have a keen interest in modern computing


technologies and want to work in an evolving industry and take part in the paradigm


shift that is now happening in the car industry. You like solving problems together


with others. You are a customer-oriented person who enjoys being part of a team


where you take the initiative and take pride in your own and the team’s deliveries.

**You and your skills**


For this position the following skills are needed:

* Proficiency in embedded system programming and testing
* Long experience of programming skill in an embedded environment using


Rust, C++ or C.

* Worked with SW system design either as SW architect or as SW design lead
* You have good skills in requirement review and test design
* Good knowledge of Unix-based tools and processes
* A good understanding of Automotive Ethernet, including UDP/TCP, and


traditional automotive communication protocols such as CAN and LIN

* You are fluent in spoken and written English


The following are meritorious, but not a must:

* Proficiency in Bash and Python programming
* You have knowledge of diagnostics protocols such as UDS and DoIP
* You have worked with Jenkins and/or Zuul CI/CD environments
* You have been working with automotive system architecture
* Self-driven, always curious and passionate person with a knack for problemsolving deep-dive
* You are an excellent networker and surely cross-functional with great


communication skills

title: Automation Engineer
description:
**On behalf of one of our clients within the life science and medical device industry, we are looking for an experienced Automation Engineer to join their site in Uppsala!**


In this role, you will take a leading part in the design, implementation, and optimization of advanced automation systems supporting high-speed production equipment in a highly regulated environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams across Manufacturing, Quality, and IT, driving automation and digitalization initiatives that improve productivity, quality, reliability, and data integrity.


This is a short-term assignment of approximately **two months**, supporting ongoing automation initiatives at the client’s site.

**As an Automation Engineer, you will:**

* Lead the design, programming, troubleshooting, and optimization of automation systems, including PLCs, HMI, and SCADA applications for manufacturing equipment.
* Define, implement, and validate automation projects in accordance with Computer System Validation (CSV) methodology and GAMP 5 standards.
* Lead automation and digitalization projects supporting the transition to electronic batch records (eBR) and integration of manufacturing systems within the SCADA environment.
* Implement and optimize vision inspection systems, including Körber/Seidenader and Cognex solutions (VIDI & Shaman).
* Collaborate with Manufacturing Engineers to deliver automated solutions that enhance productivity, reliability, quality, and data integrity.
* Serve as an OT Cybersecurity Lead, working closely with IT teams to ensure secure manufacturing operations.
* Conduct structured root cause investigations for automation and software-related issues, applying problem-solving tools aligned with non-conformity and CAPA processes.
* Act as technical owner for assigned computerized systems, leading lifecycle activities such as upgrades and obsolescence mitigation.
* Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) during audits, validations, and investigations.
* Contribute to a culture of innovation, safety, and continuous improvement across the manufacturing organization.

**Qualifications:**

* BSc or MSc in Electrical Engineering, Automation, Mechatronics, Software Engineering, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in industrial automation and control systems, preferably within pharmaceutical, medical device, or other regulated industries.
* Strong knowledge of PLC and SCADA platforms such as Rockwell Automation/FactoryTalk, Siemens TIA Portal, or CodeSys.
* Experience leading automation projects involving high-speed production equipment, motion control, robotics, or MES/eBR integration.
* Hands-on experience with vision inspection systems such as Seidenader and/or Cognex (VIDI & Shaman).
* Solid understanding of industrial communication protocols, OPC, and networked control systems.
* Knowledge of Computer System Validation (CSV), GAMP 5, ISO 13485, FDA 21 CFR Part 820, and data integrity requirements (21 CFR Part 11).
* Programming skills in Python and/or SQL are considered an advantage.
* Excellent communication, documentation, and stakeholder management skills.
* Fluency in English is required; Swedish is considered a merit but not a requirement.

 **Start:** February  

**Location:** Uppsala

 **Is this you? Don't hesitate to apply today, we conduct interviews continuously.**

**Welcome with your application!**

title: Frontend Engineer (React/TypeScript)
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 As PayPal continues its mission to revolutionize commerce, we’re looking for a skilled Frontend Software Engineer to join our team in Stockholm. In this role, you’ll take on meaningful technical challenges and work closely with cross-functional teams to build products that serve millions of users worldwide. If this sounds exciting, read on — the best is yet to come!
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Essential Responsibilities:**
* Delivers complete solutions spanning all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) (design, implementation, testing, delivery and operations), based on definitions from more senior roles.
* Advises immediate management on project-level issues
* Guides junior engineers
* Operates with little day-to-day supervision, making technical decisions based on knowledge of internal conventions and industry best practices
* Applies knowledge of technical best practices in making decisions


**Expected Qualifications:**
* Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience and a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.


**Additional Responsibilities And Preferred Qualifications**
**Your day-to-day**
 As a
 **Frontend Software Engineer** 
 , you’ll design and deliver robust, user-facing solutions while working closely with cross-functional teams to ship high-quality web products. Day to day, you’ll be involved in:
   

  

* Designing and developing scalable web applications and user interfaces
* Optimizing web performance, accessibility, and user experience
* Learning from and supporting other engineers
* Collaborating with design teams to implement pixel-perfect, responsive interfaces


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Advanced proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, with strong expertise in ES6+, asynchronous programming, and modern web development patterns.
* Extensive hands-on experience with modern web frameworks like React, Vue.js, or Angular, building scalable and maintainable web applications.
* Proven experience in developing high-performance web applications, focusing on performance optimization, accessibility (WCAG), and cross-browser compatibility.
* Strong ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, contributing to technical leadership through code reviews, design discussions, and mentoring junior engineers.
* Deep knowledge of web technologies including HTML5, CSS3, responsive design, and modern build tools (Webpack, Vite, or similar).
* Expert understanding of state management, API integration, and frontend testing frameworks, ensuring robust and maintainable code.


**Get bonus points if you also have...**
* Experience with large-scale, high-traffic web applications.
* Knowledge of web security best practices and payment processing interfaces.
* Contributions to open-source web projects.
* Micro-frontends, and modern deployment strategies (CI/CD, containerization).


**We Believe in You**
 Interested in knowing more? Don't hesitate to apply or/and let's talk – we'd love to get to know you!

That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. title: Software Engineer
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

 Role Summary
   

  

 As part of Scania’s transition to
 **sustainable transport solutions** 
 , the role focuses on coordinating and ensuring seamless collaboration between our chassis and the bodybuilder at a software level. The position offers an opportunity to work at the interface between Scania’s core vehicle systems and external bodybuilder solutions, ensuring flexibility, safety, and efficiency across diverse customer applications.
   

  

 Job Resposibilities
   

  

  

* Coordinate and oversee the integration of embedded and application-level software for electrified bus systems (e.g., battery, charging, powertrain, and energy management).
* Ensure robust integration of bodybuilder-installed functions such as HVAC, accessibility solutions and warning systems.
* Act as a technical interface for bodybuilders, supporting their integration efforts with Scania’s electrical and software platforms.
* Contribute to continuous improvements in collaboration frameworks, guidelines, and digital integration solutions.


 Who You Are
   

  

  

* Education: B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical –Engineering, or similar.
* Proficiency in C/C++ and/or Python; knowledge of MATLAB/Simulink and AUTOSAR is valuable.
* Familiarity with vehicle communication protocols (CAN, LIN, Ethernet, ISO 15118).
* Solid background in embedded or automotive software development.
* Experience with cross-functional collaboration, ideally with external partners.
* Bus driver license
* Fluent in Swedish and English


 This Is Us
   

  

 We are a passionate team supporting bus bodybuilders worldwide, educating and guiding them to build in line with the Bus Builder’s Manual. Enthusiasm drives us, because nothing spreads faster in the workplace. And yes, we are true bus lovers.
   

  

**Our Leadership Style**
 We thrive in a high-pace environment combined with deep focus tasks. Integrity, teamwork, and fun go hand in hand. We coach our people to achieve what others believe is impossible, always with one clear goal: delivering results towards our stakeholders. We hold the Scania work culture high.
   

  

  

* Be part of the most outstanding and experienced team of Bus Lovers
* A dynamic workplace with varied and challenging tasks.
* A collaborative environment where all team members support each other and contribute to project success.
* Opportunities for continuous learning and development, with training and career growth actively encouraged.
* A wide network of contacts within Scania and with international partners.
* Hands-on product knowledge of buses and their systems.
* The chance to contribute to Scania’s journey towards electrified, connected, and autonomous transport solutions.


 Scania Offers
   

  

 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application, consisting of your CV and kindly ask you not to share a cover letter to ensure an efficient and unbiased recruitment process for all parties.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-02-12. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Patricia Uranga Sarazin, Head of Body Builder Cooperation; patricia.uranga@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: AI Ops Engineer - Finance
description:
**TL;DR** 
 — You'll make sure no one at Lovable spends time on anything AI can do. We're defining how AI-native companies operate internally, across Product, GTM, and G&A. You'll own the systems that let a 200-person team move like a 2,000-person company: workflow automations, internal AI tools, data enrichment pipelines. You'll use Lovable itself to build much of this. This role is part of Project Automate Lovable, working closely with our AI Operations & Automation function and FBOS team.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity, and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Shipped production automations at a company: You've built workflow systems at scale that ran without you. Actual business-critical automations used by teams.
* Engineering brain, modern toolkit: You understand how systems actually work (APIs, databases, architecture) and can review code confidently. You move fast by choosing the right tool for the job: AI agents (Cursor, Claude Code etc) when they're faster, no-code (n8n, Lovable itself, Clay, etc.) when it fits, raw code when it's needed. Python, TypeScript, SQL etc.
* AI tool obsessed: You're always testing the latest models, apps, and workflows before anyone else. You've deployed internal AI tools (Claude/ChatGPT with custom contexts, AI agents, MCPs, etc.) at a company and you're constantly experimenting with new ones.
* Can't unsee inefficiency: You see the whole company as one machine. Once you spot a broken process, you can't leave it alone.
* High agency: You don't wait for permission. You find the bottleneck, build the fix, and ship it.
* Bonus: Ex-founder, worked at AI-native startup, or built automations across multiple business functions.


**What You’ll Do**
 Own internal AI systems that make Lovable run faster than it should.
   

  

* Define how AI-native companies operate: Help build the playbook. What we learn here scales to every company using Lovable.
* Build internal tools and workflows: Using Lovable, AI agents, no-code, raw code—whatever gets the job done fastest. Lovable on Lovable first, always.
* Deploy AI agent armies: Claude/ChatGPT with MCPs configured so every teammate has AI working for them, not the other way around.
* Squeeze value from our stack: Make the AI features in Slack, Linear, Notion, Ashby, etc. actually deliver.
* Level up the team: Turn everyone at Lovable into AI power users. Document what works. Scale it.
* Own it end-to-end: You build it, you maintain it, you improve it.


**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form, then send a quick Loom. Intro yourself and the coolest thing you've built.
* Complete a take-home: Build something that solves a real problem and shows how you think. Use Lovable or whatever gets the job done.
* Technical interview: Walk us through how you think about systems and automation.
* Cross-functional interviews: Meet your customers, the various cross-functional teammates whose work you will empower.


**About Your Application**
 Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language, so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
   

  

 We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested, please apply through our careers portal.

title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
description:
**As a Senior Embedded System Engineer, the candidate will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and optimizing embedded systems and firmware for Perten instruments.** 
 The ideal candidate should possess a strong technical background in embedded systems. Proficiency in C and C++ is essential, while knowledge of Python and C# is a plus. Experience in Linux application development and low-level hardware interaction is highly desirable. As part of our team, you will contribute to challenging projects that leverage the latest technologies in the field. You will collaborate with electronic, mechanical, and design engineers to develop new products from concept to completion. The role demands independence, responsibility, and active participation in achieving shared team goals.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and debug firmware for embedded devices and systems.
* Write efficient and optimized low-level code in C, C++.
* Develop and maintain hardware drivers for peripherals like GPIO, UART, SPI, I2C, and ADC/DAC.
* Develop and maintain firmware for microcontrollers, SoCs, and other embedded platforms.
* Collaborate with hardware teams to define system architecture and hardware requirements.
* Expert-level knowledge of embedded Linux systems, application development on Linux.
* Software development: Write and debug low-level code for hardware drivers and system control.
* Implement and debug communication protocols (e.g., SPI, I2C, UART, CAN, Ethernet).
* Testing and validation: Perform system-level testing, debugging, and validation to ensure reliability and performance. Conduct root cause analysis of firmware-related issues and implement fixes.
* Create and execute test plans for firmware and hardware validation.
* Use tools like oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and JTAG debuggers for troubleshooting.
* Document system designs, specifications, and processes for internal and external stakeholders.
* Support manufacturing and field teams in resolving technical issues.
* Strong problem-solving, debugging & Analytical skills.


**Basic Qualifications**
* Master’s degree in electrical engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
* Experience: 5+ years of hands-on experience in embedded systems development
* Proficiency in programming languages such as C, C++, and Python
* Strong understanding of microcontrollers, microprocessors, and SoCs, including ARM Cortex, Altera, and PIC architectures; FPGA and VHDL experience is a plus.
* Knowledge of communication protocols (SPI, I2C, UART, CAN, USB)
* Experience with Embedded Linux application development.
* Knowledge of power management, memory optimization, and real-time constraints.
* Experience in low-level driver development and board bring-up.
* Understanding of bootloaders, and memory management


**Preferred Characteristics**
* Experience with embedded application development on STM and ARM microcontrollers.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Familiarity with the software development lifecycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies.
* Knowledge of secure firmware development, including cryptographic protocols and secure boot.
* Hands-on experience with Raspberry Pi Compute Module development.
* A creative mindset with a top-down approach to solution design.
* Strong problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills.

title: Embedded Software System Engineer - Rust
description:
At Volvo Cars, we believe that being curious and truly committed to understanding people is the key to future success. We are people who care about other people, working together to create new technologies and innovations for safe, sustainable, and convenient mobility. Want to join us?
   

  

**This Is What Your New Colleagues Do**
 We are building a high-performance computer-in-the-car architecture. We are leaders in the paradigm shift that is happening in the car industry. A key for enabling innovation within areas such as Autonomous Drive, Advanced Connectivity, and Machine Learning. Our mission is to create a vehicle computer platform using the latest technologies and the latest chip technology in combination with more traditional car signaling technologies. We are dedicated to delivering platform functions to simplify application development to create a safe, reliable, and secure platform solution within Volvo Cars for increased innovation and speed.
   

  

 Within the Central Execution Environment, team Trust is responsible for the Low Power Unit (LPA) team. Completely in-house developed in Rust. New projects are being prepared, and here we are looking for a senior software system engineer. The location is Gothenburg or Lund.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As a software system engineer for this position, you will:
   

  

* Develop software using Rust programming language
* Participate in the system architecture design
* Break down requirements
* Create test cases
* Handle build system and support tools
* Handle our CI/CD infrastructure
* Handle and improve the release process
* Advanced engineering R&D investigations
* Supporting the different work groups & and stakeholders
* Fault-finding
* Work in a highly empowered agile team that is responsible for creating


 everything from requirements and software architecture to implementation
   

  

 and test
   

  

**Who are you?**
 We want to work with those of you who have a keen interest in modern computing
   

  

 technologies and want to work in an evolving industry and take part in the paradigm
   

  

 shift that is now happening in the car industry. You like solving problems together
   

  

 with others. You are a customer-oriented person who enjoys being part of a team
   

  

 where you take the initiative and take pride in your own and the team’s deliveries.
   

  

**You And Your Skills**
 For this position the following skills are needed:
   

  

* Proficiency in embedded system programming and testing
* Long experience of programming skill in an embedded environment using


 Rust, C++ or C.
   

  

* Worked with SW system design either as SW architect or as SW design lead
* You have good skills in requirement review and test design
* Good knowledge of Unix-based tools and processes
* A good understanding of Automotive Ethernet, including UDP/TCP, and


 traditional automotive communication protocols such as CAN and LIN
   

  

* You are fluent in spoken and written English


 The following are meritorious, but not a must:
   

  

* Proficiency in Bash and Python programming
* You have knowledge of diagnostics protocols such as UDS and DoIP
* You have worked with Jenkins and/or Zuul CI/CD environments
* You have been working with automotive system architecture
* Self-driven, always curious and passionate person with a knack for problemsolving deep-dive
* You are an excellent networker and surely cross-functional with great


 communication skills
